4.  **Alex Turk**  
    Fan writer
    
    ![Image 31: Manchester United fan's voice banner](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/d13f/live/f1ac4610-3b6c-11ee-bde6-7ffba94c56ae.jpg.webp)
    
    ![Image 32: Ruben Amorim crouches on the touchline during Manchester United's game at Ipswich](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/012c/live/6ad04300-ab58-11ef-9323-7924a1e1d563.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    Why did Manchester United not look as good as Sporting against [Ipswich Town](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/ipswich-town) on Sunday? Can this Ruben Amorim fella walk the walk as well as he talks the talk? How is this 3-4-3 system going to click?
    
    Those would be questions of an individual needing to understand the reality of the situation Amorim has inherited from Erik ten Hag.
    
    Such a drastic change of vision would have been challenging to instil with a full pre-season at his disposal. United visited Portman Road with two training sessions in the tank.
    
    Amorim understands that only wins will buy him time, but that has not deterred his repeated cries for patience.
    
    As long as he persists with his three-at-the-back philosophy and his guarantee of a clear identity - something United have missed for far too long - supporters will offer the patience he desires.
    
    Not much sense is required to understand why the Red Devils did not enjoy a winning start to life under Amorim at Ipswich.
    
    It was simple. The 3-4-3 formation was present, unlike the profile of player that made his tactics so effective in Portugal.
    
    Amorim's high-octane demands are not built for a 36-year-old operating as a left-sided centre-back and two midfielders aged 32 powering the engine room.
    
    United lacked legs in defence and midfield - already a known issue - and efficient decision-making in attack - also no surprise.
    
    Amorim cannot be judged this early on.
    
    I loved his post-match quote about staying true to his plan, regardless of the squad at his disposal, rather than adapting his methods in search of short-term results.
    
    Ten Hag opted for the latter, ultimately prompting the arrival of the sixth permanent boss since Sir Alex Ferguson after a predictable plight.
    
    This time around, the focus should be on short-term pain for long-term gain.
    
    _Find more from Alex Turk at_ [_Stretford Paddock_, external](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC7w8GnTF2Sp3wldDMtCCtVw)
    
    ![Image 33: An image detailing how to follow your Premier League team on BBC Sport: "On the app? Tap the bell icon to get news about your club sent to you. Signed in on a browser? Hit 'Follow' to stay up to date.](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/266a/live/483e2580-b62d-11ee-bc2f-cb5579b90709.jpg.webp)
    
5.  ![Image 34: Andre Onana](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/2556/live/21f03ae0-abef-11ef-a678-8d26f6b8be8a.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    Image caption,
    
    Andre Onana joined Manchester United from Inter Milan for £47m in July 2023
    
    Manchester United goalkeeper Andre Onana has been given the Player Impact Award by international players' union Fifpro for his charity work.
    
    Onana set up the Andre Onana Foundation to provide free medical care and surgeries for underprivileged children and adults in Cameroon and other countries in sub-Saharan Africa.
    
    Doctors have performed more than 1,200 operations in the past three years.
    
    Onana, 28, said he felt "a responsibility to give back and help others".
    
    "When I passed through Barcelona, Amsterdam and Milan on my way to Manchester United, I had people who helped me on that journey," he said.
    
    "When I was down, they gave me a hand so that I could stand up. I’ve never forgotten the help I received."
    
6.  BBC Radio 5 Live's Monday Night Club debated Manchester United's draw with [Ipswich](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/ipswich-town) in Ruben Amorim's first game in charge.
    
    Former Premier League midfielder Michael Brown described the performance as a "reality check" and Chris Sutton said Amorim will have realised the squad is "bang average" and that "there is a hell of a lot of work to do".

7.  When Marcus Rashford scored within the first two minutes of Ruben Amorim's Manchester United era beginning, it had many fans wondering just what might be possible.
    
    But they were brought back down to earth by [Ipswich](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/ipswich-town) winger Omari Hutchinson's strike before half-time.
    
    And in the latest episode of BBC Radio Manchester's The Devils' Advocate podcast, the team have been deciding what to make of the new boss' first game in charge.

8.  ![Image 37: Gossip graphic](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/c043/live/ecb3f520-0913-11ef-82e8-cd354766a224.png.webp)

9.  ![Image 38: The Devils' Advocate podcast graphic](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/01d2/live/6e70c820-3aa3-11ef-a044-9d4367d5b599.jpg.webp)
    
    Ruben Amorim's first game in charge of Manchester United ended in a 1-1 draw against Ipswich Town and the latest episode of BBC Radio Manchester's The Devils' Advocate has landed to unpick it all.
    
    In this week's show, Gaz Drinkwater and Joe McGrath look at who stood out at Portman Road and discuss how United's players took to the new system.
    
    [Listen to the full episode on BBC Sounds](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sounds/play/p0k6swr7)
    
    ![Image 39: Listen on BBC Sounds banner](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/2e39/live/e93a4330-3aa1-11ef-bbe0-29f79e992ddd.jpg.webp)
    
10.  ![Image 40: Chief football writer Phil McNulty byline banner](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/55a5/live/13026c10-3aa7-11ef-bbe0-29f79e992ddd.jpg.webp)
    
    ![Image 41: Manchester United's Portuguese head coach Ruben Amorim (L) shakes hands with Manchester United's Cameroonian goalkeeper #24 Andre Onana (R) at the end of the English Premier League football match between Ipswich Town and Manchester United at Portman Road](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/e00e/live/579abfe0-ab44-11ef-8ab9-9192db313061.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    **BBC Sport's chief football writer Phil McNulty has been answering your questions.**
    
    **Mike asked:** Manchester United may 'only' be six points off fourth place, but there are a lot of teams in between. Clearly not all teams above are going to drop more points than United do. I feel we should stop focusing on fourth place and focus on improvement for next season. Where we finish is where we finish.
    
    I don't know if it is instant gratification or a lack of knowledge among many fans, but (tell me if I am wrong) a new coach does not simply say: 'Now we set up like this, you play this position and problem solved'. It takes a lot of time and practice to replace old ways and habits with new ones.
    
    I say we need to be patient and judge it in the new season. What is your take on whether Manchester United are likely to improve?
    
    **Phil answered:** These are all very good points and Ruben Amorim made a lot of them himself after the draw at Ipswich Town, when he pointed out that Manchester United will have to "suffer" while he implements his tactical tweaks, saying it was worth risking things tactically now to feel the benefit next season.
    
    So yes, patience will be needed and, in my experience, Manchester United fans are remarkably patient with their managers.
    
    What we have seen from Amorim already is a clear identity in terms of how he wants to play and a clear idea of his strategy. I don't think we ever really saw that from Erik ten Hag.
    
    I think United will improve – and I wouldn't write off fourth place either, because I really believe that slot is wide open – but it will take time and patience, and there will be bumps along the way.
    
11.  [### 14:26 25 NovemberSheeran sorry for interrupting Amorim interview, published at 14:26 25 NovemberSheeran sorry for interrupting Amorim interview](https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/articles/cyv7zgj0l52o)
    
    *   Attribution
        
        [Premier League](https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/premier-league)
        
    
    ![Image 42: Ed Sheeran at Ipswich Town ](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/480/cpsprodpb/551d/live/b20d9400-ab37-11ef-8d14-b38ce06af7f3.jpg)
    
12.  ![Image 44: Ruben Amorim crouches on touchline during match](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/91ba/live/8b2c9540-ab21-11ef-8487-d5a0de19ffaf.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    Manchester United's new formation may have to "evolve into something else" if they are going to being competitive in the Premier League, says former [Liverpool](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/liverpool) midfielder Danny Murphy.
    
    New boss Ruben Amorim used his favoured formation of three at the back in his first game in charge against [Ipswich](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/ipswich-town) on Sunday.
    
    It was an unfamiliar set-up for the backline and, despite United taking an early lead within two minutes, they ultimately drew 1-1 against the newly promoted side.
    
    "I would be amazed if they are still playing a 3-4-3 in a year's time," Murphy said on Match of the Day 2.
    
    "This league is very, very different than continental leagues. We have only had [Chelsea](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/chelsea) in recent years win playing that system. And, let's be honest, they had Kante and Matic - two wonderful midfielders in the middle of the pitch, plus Costa up top with Hazard supporting him and helping them as well.
    
    "They \[Manchester United\] don't have those players yet and how do you find them? It costs hundreds of millions to get the best players in the world.
    
    "When you play three at the back against the majority of good teams in our league who play three high, you end up being a five and that is really difficult.
    
    "If Manchester United are going to become much better and be competitive, I think that 3-4-3 will evolve into something else."
    
    [Watch the full discussion on BBC iPlayer](https://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episode/m0025f6r/match-of-the-day-2-202425-24112024)
    
13.  ![Image 45: Your views banner](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/2f7f/live/95709000-0915-11ef-bee9-6125e244a4cd.jpg.webp)
    
    ![Image 46: Luke Shaw of Manchester United battles for possession with Omari Hutchinson of Ipswich Town](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/39c4/live/f4a5c660-aaa7-11ef-821d-af5442865c2a.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    We asked for your thoughts after Sunday's Premier League game between Ipswich Town and Manchester United, which ended in a 1-1 draw.
    
    Here are some of your comments:
    
    **Ipswich towns**
    
    **Matt**: I thought we looked like a proper Premier League team. We were better than Manchester United. This line-up is definitely our strongest 11 (apart from the absent Greaves). If we continue to play like this we will stay up. Omari was outstanding.
    
    **James**: This was another step in the right direction for Town, with a fully deserved point. It was frustrating to concede so early, as we were the team in the ascendancy in the first half, which was capped by a superb goal by Omari Hutchinson. There wasn't much between the two sides in the second half and we again showed our resilience to see out the draw.
    
    **Michael**: Wonderful performance by Town after what some would say is our regular early mistake. We battled well and had we won the game it would not have been an injustice. Credit should also go to the referee, Anthony Taylor, who allowed the game to flow and kept control throughout.
    
    **Phillip**: We more than matched a top team in the Premier League/ Europe. We probably should have got all three points. We have to believe in this fantastic team of ours because we were brilliant, as we were at T[ottenham](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/tottenham-hotspur). We are building something special. Kieran McKenna, what can I say, amazing achievement. Absolutely buzzing.
    
    **United fans**
    
    **Mike58**: Obviously disappointed not to win but a draw was the least Ipswich deserved. Signs of life to come - a manager/coach with tactical knowledge and an identity. He will improve these players, for sure. Having had only days to work with these players he has overachieved. Onana clear player of the match for United.
    
    **Mark**: Early days but the same old problems resurfaced and we need to stop giving the ball away cheaply. We bossed the second half and deserved the win, but the cutting edge is still missing up front and we should be more clinical. Hopefully Amorin will iron these problems out and we will improve - slowly but steadily.
    
    **Toni**: Wasn't expecting miracles, to be honest. Amorim has a lot of work to do. However, some players can be moved on in January. We cannot and must not have a squad of uninterested professionals. A draw was good enough but we need more effort.
    
    **Davos**: A steady start for Amorim. He has plenty of work to do to get the boys firing on all cylinders. The midfield seemed a little slow at times and we just need a striker to be in the box for when the ball is played into that area as both Zirkzee and Hojlund look lost. Onwards and upwards.
    
    ![Image 47: An image detailing how to follow your Premier League team on BBC Sport: "On the app? Tap the bell icon to get news about your club sent to you. Signed in on a browser? Hit 'Follow' to stay up to date.](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/51a6/live/913754d0-476b-11ef-96a8-e710c6bfc866.jpg.webp)
    
14.  **Simon Stone**  
    Chief football news reporter
    
    ![Image 48: Monday's news paper back pages](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/0916/live/73b44a40-ab0b-11ef-bdf5-b7cb2fa86e10.jpg.webp)Image source, Mirror and Star
    
    Image caption,
    
    Monday's papers focus on Amorim's view his players will "suffer" in order to progress
    
    Ruben Amorim asked Manchester United's hierarchy if he could join the club in the summer rather than in mid-season.
    
    United said no.
    
    It is different owners calling the shots at Old Trafford now but their memories wouldn't have to be long to recall the issues created by Ralf Rangnick's ill-fated stint as interim.
    
    Their reasoning for wanting Amorim now are sound.
    
    Similarly, Amorim is one of the most highly rated young coaches in Europe. United chief executive Omar Berrada is a big fan. Going after him also made sense.
    
    The problem is having made the calls, United are now in a position where the new coach is trying to implement a new playing style, knowing there are too many midweek matches looming to allow proper training on shape and positioning, which may lead to unexpected defeats.
    
    As a club, they cannot afford to just toss away seasons as part of a big rebuild. That is not the idea behind bringing someone in like Amorim.
    
    But, at best, it is a calculated gamble.
    
    United dropped two points at Portman Road. They remain in the bottom half of the table. That situation needs to change.
    
    ![Image 49: Monday's newspaper back pages](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/8ea9/live/578e53b0-ab0b-11ef-a4fe-a3e9a6c5d640.jpg.webp)Image source, Daily Express and Guardian
    
15.  ![Image 50: Ruben Amorim ](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/1b47/live/36ed8ac0-ab08-11ef-b429-5b139d1e7a7e.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    Former Premier League striker Glenn Murray is confident that Manchester United's performances under Ruben Amorim "will only get better" but believes the new boss will be working on the fitness of his players.
    
    Amorim kicked-off his tenure on Sunday with a draw at [Ipswich Town](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/ipswich-town), leaving United 12th in the Premier League.
    
    "Anyone at Manchester United should be good enough to fall into a different system under any manager," said Murray on the BBC Radio 5 Live Football Daily podcast. "I am glad that he lined the team-up in the way he wanted as 3-4-3 is his identity and I am sure it will only get better.
    
    "One thing I noticed is that he is not happy with their physicality. He wants them to be fitter."
    
    Despite their fast start, with Marcus Rashford scoring after just 81 seconds, United soon settled into a familiar pattern and found themselves exposed far too easily when Ipswich countered.
    
    "Amorim will be looking at this group of players and already thinking that some of them will not be here in a few months time," added former Premier League midfielder Don Hutchison. "He knows he will need to move a lot of these players on.
    
    "But you can understand and see what he wants to do in the future."

23.  ![Image 66: Ruben Amorim, Head Coach of Manchester United, interacts with Alejandro Garnacho](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/4e6a/live/8f8c1d10-aa98-11ef-a1c0-573b01005cc8.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    **Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim, speaking to BBC Sport**: "Not a good result but it is a tough league with high intensity. We started very well but should have had more of the ball. But we are learning."
    
    **On adapting to his formation**: "It was really hard for them, they were thinking what to do, it was not fluid which is normal after just two training sessions but they tried hard. They have so much space to improve. But after a draw you never feel the good things. So I am really happy because they tried but they can do so much better."
    
    **On the early goal**: "We worked on that but they have the talent to do it, and then it is all about the players."
    
    **On Noussair Mazraoui**: "We don't have too many centre-backs so we have to adapt some players. I thought Noussair Mazraoui did very well. He is so smart and is so important for us. He can play anywhere and that kind of player is crucial for our future."
    
    **On his first taste of the Premier League**: "It is a great environment, a great spectacle. But when the game starts it is like I am back in Portugal or the third division. I am so focused everything is the same. You guys are so lucky to have the best league in the world. I am really happy to be here but today I don't feel much because I like to win games."
    
24.  ![Image 67: Manchester United's Portuguese head coach Ruben Amorim shouts to his players](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/012f/live/e1ae36a0-aa93-11ef-ae17-6d95a5d1f2ff.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    Ruben Amorim became only the second permanent manager in Premier League history to see his side score within the opening two minutes of his very first game in charge, along with David Moyes with [Everton](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/everton) in March 2002.
    
    However, this was just the second time Manchester United have scored inside the opening two minutes of a Premier League game and failed to win, also drawing 2-2 with [Liverpool](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/liverpool) in October 1995 and losing 1-6 to [Tottenham](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/tottenham-hotspur) in October 2020.","usage":{"tokens":10093}}

**_Manchester United are keen on Wolves wing-back Rayan Ait-Nouri, but face competition for Chelsea striker Christopher Nkunku, Newcastle may need to sell before pursuing move for Bournemouth's Antoine Semenyo._**

New **Manchester United** manager Ruben Amorim is keen on **Wolves'** 23-year-old Algeria wing-back, Rayan Ait-Nouri. [(Sun), external](https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/31913903/man-utd-amorim-transfer-wolves-ait-nouri/)

The Red Devils are also interested in **Chelsea's** Christopher Nkunku but could face competition from **Borussia** **Dortmund** for the 27-year-old France forward. [(Teamtalk), external](https://www.teamtalk.com/news/man-utd-transfers-rival-dortmund-frustrated-chelsea-ace-perfect-ruben-amorim-signing-sources)

**Newcastle** are interested in **Bournemouth's** 24-year-old Ghana forward Antoine Semenyo but are unlikely to make a January move unless other players leave. [(Sky Sports), external](https://www.skysports.com/football/live-blog/11095/13025496/newcastle-transfer-news-rumours-and-gossip-live-updates-and-latest-on-deals-signings-loans-and-contracts?postid=8677197#liveblog-body)

**Fulham** and **Leicester** are eyeing a loan deal in January for **Brighton's** 20-year-old Republic of Ireland striker, Evan Ferguson. [(Football Insider), external](https://www.footballinsider247.com/exclusive-fulham-and-leicester-city-set-sights-on-evan-ferguson-deal/)

**Manchester City** are not looking to take advantage of a buy-back clause to bring English striker Liam Delap, 21, from **Ipswich**. [(Give Me Sport), external](https://www.givemesport.com/manchester-city-transfer-news-not-interested-triggering-delap-buyback-clause-etihad-stadium/)

**Everton** boss Sean Dyche has the full backing of current owner Farhad Moshiri and will be in charge for the foreseeable future. [(Sky Sports), external](https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11671/13260156/everton-reporter-notebook-sean-dyche-has-full-backing-of-current-ownership-despite-fan-discontent)

**Manchester United** have enquired about **Sporting's** 17-year-old Portugal U21s winger Geovany Quenda, who is valued at 60m euros (£50.1m). [(A Bola - in Portuguese), external](https://www.abola.pt/futebol/noticias/euro60-m-mais-bonus-para-o-man-united-levar-quenda-do-sporting-2024112422534275437)

The Red Devils are also targeting a number of strikers, with **PSG's** 25-year-old France international Randal Kolo Muani and **Eintracht Frankfurt's** Egypt forward Omar Marmoush, 25, on the club's radar. [(Sky Germany - in German), external](https://sport.sky.de/transfer/news/34132/13260554/marmoush-boniface-davies-transfer-themen-bei-manchester-united)

**United** are monitoring **Wolves'** 25-year-old Brazil forward Matheus Cunha, with **Tottenham** also showing interest. [(TBR Football), external](https://tbrfootball.com/what-wolves-have-told-gary-oneil-about-matheus-cunha-as-man-united-and-tottenham-circle-ahead-of-january/)

**AC Milan** are set to rival **Newcastle** for the signing of **Everton's** 27-year-old England striker Dominic Calvert-Lewin, while **Real Madrid** are considering a move for the Toffees' England defender Jarrad Branthwaite, 22. [(Teamtalk), external](https://www.teamtalk.com/news/everton-transfers-ac-milan-battle-newcastle-star-team-mate-concrete-real-madrid-target-sources)

**Manchester City** are confident Norway striker Erling Haaland, 24, will follow manager Pep Guardiola in signing a new contract with the club. [(Give Me Sport), external](https://www.givemesport.com/manchester-city-transfer-news-increasingly-confident-haaland-agree-deal-etihad-stadium/)

**Barcelona** are eyeing a 70m euro (£58.4m) deal for **Sporting Lisbon's** 26-year-old Sweden striker, Viktor Gyokeres. [(Sport - in Spanish), external](https://www.sport.es/es/noticias/barca/formula-barca-fichar-gyoekeres-112041417)

**Brighton** are to take **Cork** **City's** 17-year-old Ireland Under-18s winger Matthew Murray on trial. [(Irish Mirror), external](https://www.irishmirror.ie/sport/soccer/soccer-news/brighton-take-highly-rated-cork-34185391)

**Nottingham Forest** are confident they will agree a new contract with 28-year-old Nigeria full-back Ola Aina. [(Football Insider), external](https://www.footballinsider247.com/nottingham-forest-confident-of-agreeing-ola-aina-deal-sources/)

**PSG's** 29-year-old Slovakia defender **Milan Skriniar** is set to join Juventus in the January transfer window. [(Foot Mercato - in French), external](https://www.footmercato.net/a5501618204879572456-psg-milan-skriniar-a-donne-son-accord-a-la-juventus)

Tottenham may look to sign a goalkeeper in January after Italy's Guglielmo Vicario, 28, suffered a broken ankle that required surgery. [(Telegraph - subscription required), external](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2024/11/25/tottenham-transfer-news-vicario-injury-keeper-january/)

**Manchester United** have enquired about **Sporting's** 17-year-old Portugal U21s winger Geovany Quenda, who is valued at 60m euros (£50.1m). The Red Devils are also targeting a number of strikers, with **PSG's** 25-year-old France international Randal Kolo Muani and **Eintracht Frankfurt's** Egypt forward Omar Marmoush, 25, on the club's radar. [(Sky Germany - in German), external](https://sport.sky.de/transfer/news/34132/13260554/marmoush-boniface-davies-transfer-themen-bei-manchester-united)

**United** are monitoring **Wolves'** 25-year-old Brazil forward Matheus Cunha, with **Tottenham** also showing interest. [(TBR Football), external](https://tbrfootball.com/what-wolves-have-told-gary-oneil-about-matheus-cunha-as-man-united-and-tottenham-circle-ahead-of-january/)

**AC Milan** are set to rival **Newcastle** for the signing of **Everton's** 27-year-old England striker Dominic Calvert-Lewin, while **Real Madrid** are considering a move for the Toffees' England defender Jarrad Branthwaite, 22. [(Teamtalk), external](https://www.teamtalk.com/news/everton-transfers-ac-milan-battle-newcastle-star-team-mate-concrete-real-madrid-target-sources)

**Manchester City** are confident Norway striker Erling Haaland, 24, will follow manager Pep Guardiola in signing a new contract with the club. [(Give Me Sport), external](https://www.givemesport.com/manchester-city-transfer-news-increasingly-confident-haaland-agree-deal-etihad-stadium/)

**Barcelona** are eyeing a 70m euro (£58.4m) deal for **Sporting Lisbon's** 26-year-old Sweden striker, Viktor Gyokeres. [(Sport - in Spanish), external](https://www.sport.es/es/noticias/barca/formula-barca-fichar-gyoekeres-112041417)

**Brighton** are to take **Cork** **City's** 17-year-old Ireland Under-18s winger Matthew Murray on trial. [(Irish Mirror), external](https://www.irishmirror.ie/sport/soccer/soccer-news/brighton-take-highly-rated-cork-34185391)

**Nottingham Forest** are confident they will agree a new contract with 28-year-old Nigeria full-back Ola Aina. [(Football Insider), external](https://www.footballinsider247.com/nottingham-forest-confident-of-agreeing-ola-aina-deal-sources/)

**PSG's** 29-year-old Slovakia defender **Milan Skriniar** is set to join Juventus in the January transfer window. [(Foot Mercato - in French), external](https://www.footmercato.net/a5501618204879572456-psg-milan-skriniar-a-donne-son-accord-a-la-juventus)

Tottenham may look to sign a goalkeeper in January after Italy's Guglielmo Vicario, 28, suffered a broken ankle that required surgery. [(Telegraph - subscription required), external](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2024/11/25/tottenham-transfer-news-vicario-injury-keeper-january/)

data: {"title":"Van Nistelrooy could help Man United complete four transfers amid new job talk","description":"The latest Manchester United transfer news and opinion as the former striker is the bookmakers odds-on favourite for the vacant Leicester City job.","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-could-help-30458046","content":"Ruud van Nistelrooy could help Manchester United complete four transfers amid new job talk - Amie Wilson - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                 

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

Ruud van Nistelrooy could help Manchester United complete four transfers amid new job talk
==========================================================================================

The latest Manchester United transfer news and opinion as the former striker is the bookmakers odds-on favourite for the vacant Leicester City job.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-could-help-30458046#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

[Amie Wilson](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/amie-wilson/)

*   19:30, 26 NOV 2024
*   Updated19:34, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Ruud van Nistelrooy during the UEFA Europa League 2024/25 League Phase MD4 match between Manchester United and PAOK FC at Old Trafford.](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article30458094.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Manchester-United-v-PAOK-FC-UEFA-Europa-League-202425-League-Phase-MD4.jpg)

Ruud van Nisterooy is odds-on favourite to take over at Leicester City following his exit from Manchester United. (Image: Naomi Baker/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

There has been a lot of talk over the future of [Ruud van Nistelrooy](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruud-van-nistelrooy) since his [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) exit just a couple of weeks ago.

The former striker returned to United in the summer as assistant to [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag). The manager’s sacking in October led to van Nistelrooy taking interim charge of the club.

In his four games in charge, United won three and drew one. Two of those wins came against Leicester City - a 5-2 Carabao Cup victory and a 3-0 win in the Premier League.

The appointment of [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) led to uncertainty over van Nistelrooy’s future, and it was announced on the new head coach’s first day at the club that he would be leaving. It now seems that [van Nistelrooy is set for a quick return to coaching](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-next-job-30450187).

**READ MORE: [New Man United financial figures highlight major issue INEOS have to solve](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/new-man-united-financial-figures-30457666)**

**READ MORE: [Sir Alex Ferguson made me promise when I joined Man United - he broke it for Liverpool](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/alex-ferguson-liverpool-man-utd-30457621)**

Following the sacking of Steve Cooper, the Dutchman is currently odds-on favourite to take over at Leicester. If it does happen, a reunion withe United will be on the cards in March when they travel to the King Power Stadium.

Van Nistelrooy;s relationship with United could potentially benefit both clubs, especially with the January transfer window not far away. With that in mind, here are four United players that the former coach could potentially sign with his new club.

#### Harry Maguire

The centre-back’s time at United looks to be coming to an end, so could a return to his former club be a possibility? Maguire joined United from Leiceter in the summer of 2019 for a fee of £80 million after two successful seasons at the club, where he also established himself as an England regular.

The 31-year-old has just six months remaining on his contract at Old Trafford. So he can either be sold for a reduced fee in January, or move on for nothing in the summer.

Leicester do have Conor Coady and Jannik Vestergaard as the more experienced centre-back options, but could turn to Maguire if they want to add to their backline.

#### Toby Collyer

The 20-year-old has broken into the squad this season, making an appearance in the second half of the 3-0 defeat against Liverpool back in September. He has however, struggled for appearances since then and has not made the squad in the last seven Premier League games.

A loan move for more game time, and if that could come with a Premier League club like Leicester, then all the better. The Foxes do however have both of their loan slots taken up, it would mean that they would have to either send back or arrange a permanent deal for the two players currently on loan to do another temporary deal.

#### Antony

Antony has failed to live up to his price tag at United since making the move from Ajax in 2022. United paid an initial £82 million fee to bring him to Old Trafford.

It has however been rumoured that they could look to move the winger on in the upcoming transfer window. To do that, it will either have to be for a greatly reduced price, or on a loan deal.

If United could send him on loan to a fellow Premier League club and he refinds his form and confidence. His return would either help him start again at the club, or increase his asking price in the summer window.

#### Ethan Wheatley

Leicester are expected to be on the lookout for another forward in the January window, and that could be the case even more if van Nistelrooy is in charge. If they have a loan slot available, then on possibility could be young United striker Ethan Wheatley.

He has been named in the squad for the Europa League games against Fenerbahce and PAOK, as well as Premier League matches against Liverpool, Southampton, Brentford, West Ham and Chelsea.

The chance to work with van Nistelrooy again as well as getting more Premier League experience could be invaluable for the youngster as he looks to break into the United first team.

Ruud van Nistelrooy could help Manchester United complete four transfers amid new job talk
==========================================================================================

The latest Manchester United transfer news and opinion as the former striker is the bookmakers odds-on favourite for the vacant Leicester City job.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

By

[Amie Wilson](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/amie-wilson/)

*   19:30, 26 NOV 2024
*   Updated19:34, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Ruud van Nistelrooy during the UEFA Europa League 2024/25 League Phase MD4 match between Manchester United and PAOK FC at Old Trafford.](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article30458094.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Manchester-United-v-PAOK-FC-UEFA-Europa-League-202425-League-Phase-MD4.jpg)

Ruud van Nisterooy is odds-on favourite to take over at Leicester City following his exit from Manchester United. (Image: Naomi Baker/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

There has been a lot of talk over the future of [Ruud van Nistelrooy](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruud-van-nistelrooy) since his [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) exit just a couple of weeks ago.

The former striker returned to United in the summer as assistant to [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag). The manager’s sacking in October led to van Nistelrooy taking interim charge of the club.

In his four games in charge, United won three and drew one. Two of those wins came against Leicester City - a 5-2 Carabao Cup victory and a 3-0 win in the Premier League.

The appointment of [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) led to uncertainty over van Nistelrooy’s future, and it was announced on the new head coach’s first day at the club that he would be leaving. It now seems that [van Nistelrooy is set for a quick return to coaching](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-next-job-30450187).

**READ MORE: [New Man United financial figures highlight major issue INEOS have to solve](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/new-man-united-financial-figures-30457666)**

**READ MORE: [Sir Alex Ferguson made me promise when I joined Man United - he broke it for Liverpool](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/alex-ferguson-liverpool-man-utd-30457621)**

Following the sacking of Steve Cooper, the Dutchman is currently odds-on favourite to take over at Leicester. If it does happen, a reunion withe United will be on the cards in March when they travel to the King Power Stadium.

Van Nistelrooy;s relationship with United could potentially benefit both clubs, especially with the January transfer window not far away. With that in mind, here are four United players that the former coach could potentially sign with his new club.

#### Harry Maguire

The centre-back’s time at United looks to be coming to an end, so could a return to his former club be a possibility? Maguire joined United from Leiceter in the summer of 2019 for a fee of £80 million after two successful seasons at the club, where he also established himself as an England regular.

The 31-year-old has just six months remaining on his contract at Old Trafford. So he can either be sold for a reduced fee in January, or move on for nothing in the summer.

Leicester do have Conor Coady and Jannik Vestergaard as the more experienced centre-back options, but could turn to Maguire if they want to add to their backline.

#### Toby Collyer

The 20-year-old has broken into the squad this season, making an appearance in the second half of the 3-0 defeat against Liverpool back in September. He has however, struggled for appearances since then and has not made the squad in the last seven Premier League games.

A loan move for more game time, and if that could come with a Premier League club like Leicester, then all the better. The Foxes do however have both of their loan slots taken up, it would mean that they would have to either send back or arrange a permanent deal for the two players currently on loan to do another temporary deal.

#### Antony

Antony has failed to live up to his price tag at United since making the move from Ajax in 2022. United paid an initial £82 million fee to bring him to Old Trafford.

It has however been rumoured that they could look to move the winger on in the upcoming transfer window. To do that, it will either have to be for a greatly reduced price, or on a loan deal.

If United could send him on loan to a fellow Premier League club and he refinds his form and confidence. His return would either help him start again at the club, or increase his asking price in the summer window.

#### Ethan Wheatley

Leicester are expected to be on the lookout for another forward in the January window, and that could be the case even more if van Nistelrooy is in charge. If they have a loan slot available, then on possibility could be young United striker Ethan Wheatley.

He has been named in the squad for the Europa League games against Fenerbahce and PAOK, as well as Premier League matches against Liverpool, Southampton, Brentford, West Ham and Chelsea.

The chance to work with van Nistelrooy again as well as getting more Premier League experience could be invaluable for the youngster as he looks to break into the United first team.

data: {"title":"Van Nistelrooy could help Man United complete four transfers amid new job talk","description":"The latest Manchester United transfer news and opinion as the former striker is the bookmakers odds-on favourite for the vacant Leicester City job.","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-could-help-30458046","content":"Ruud van Nistelrooy could help Manchester United complete four transfers amid new job talk - Amie Wilson - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                  

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

Ruud van Nistelrooy could help Manchester United complete four transfers amid new job talk
==========================================================================================

The latest Manchester United transfer news and opinion as the former striker is the bookmakers odds-on favourite for the vacant Leicester City job.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments3](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-could-help-30458046#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

[Amie Wilson](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/amie-wilson/)

*   19:30, 26 NOV 2024
*   Updated19:34, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Ruud van Nistelrooy during the UEFA Europa League 2024/25 League Phase MD4 match between Manchester United and PAOK FC at Old Trafford.](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article30458094.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Manchester-United-v-PAOK-FC-UEFA-Europa-League-202425-League-Phase-MD4.jpg)

Ruud van Nisterooy is odds-on favourite to take over at Leicester City following his exit from Manchester United. (Image: Naomi Baker/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

There has been a lot of talk over the future of [Ruud van Nistelrooy](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruud-van-nistelrooy) since his [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) exit just a couple of weeks ago.

The former striker returned to United in the summer as assistant to [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag). The manager’s sacking in October led to van Nistelrooy taking interim charge of the club.

In his four games in charge, United won three and drew one. Two of those wins came against Leicester City - a 5-2 Carabao Cup victory and a 3-0 win in the Premier League.

The appointment of [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) led to uncertainty over van Nistelrooy’s future, and it was announced on the new head coach’s first day at the club that he would be leaving. It now seems that [van Nistelrooy is set for a quick return to coaching](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-next-job-30450187).

**READ MORE: [New Man United financial figures highlight major issue INEOS have to solve](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/new-man-united-financial-figures-30457666)**

**READ MORE: [Sir Alex Ferguson made me promise when I joined Man United - he broke it for Liverpool](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/alex-ferguson-liverpool-man-utd-30457621)**

Following the sacking of Steve Cooper, the Dutchman is currently odds-on favourite to take over at Leicester. If it does happen, a reunion withe United will be on the cards in March when they travel to the King Power Stadium.

Van Nistelrooy;s relationship with United could potentially benefit both clubs, especially with the January transfer window not far away. With that in mind, here are four United players that the former coach could potentially sign with his new club.

#### Harry Maguire

The centre-back’s time at United looks to be coming to an end, so could a return to his former club be a possibility? Maguire joined United from Leiceter in the summer of 2019 for a fee of £80 million after two successful seasons at the club, where he also established himself as an England regular.

The 31-year-old has just six months remaining on his contract at Old Trafford. So he can either be sold for a reduced fee in January, or move on for nothing in the summer.

Leicester do have Conor Coady and Jannik Vestergaard as the more experienced centre-back options, but could turn to Maguire if they want to add to their backline.

#### Toby Collyer

The 20-year-old has broken into the squad this season, making an appearance in the second half of the 3-0 defeat against Liverpool back in September. He has however, struggled for appearances since then and has not made the squad in the last seven Premier League games.

A loan move for more game time, and if that could come with a Premier League club like Leicester, then all the better. The Foxes do however have both of their loan slots taken up, it would mean that they would have to either send back or arrange a permanent deal for the two players currently on loan to do another temporary deal.

#### Antony

Antony has failed to live up to his price tag at United since making the move from Ajax in 2022. United paid an initial £82 million fee to bring him to Old Trafford.

It has however been rumoured that they could look to move the winger on in the upcoming transfer window. To do that, it will either have to be for a greatly reduced price, or on a loan deal.

If United could send him on loan to a fellow Premier League club and he refinds his form and confidence. His return would either help him start again at the club, or increase his asking price in the summer window.

#### Ethan Wheatley

Leicester are expected to be on the lookout for another forward in the January window, and that could be the case even more if van Nistelrooy is in charge. If they have a loan slot available, then on possibility could be young United striker Ethan Wheatley.

He has been named in the squad for the Europa League games against Fenerbahce and PAOK, as well as Premier League matches against Liverpool, Southampton, Brentford, West Ham and Chelsea.

The chance to work with van Nistelrooy again as well as getting more Premier League experience could be invaluable for the youngster as he looks to break into the United first team.

data: {"title":"Van Nistelrooy could help Man United complete four transfers amid new job talk","description":"The latest Manchester United transfer news and opinion as the former striker is the bookmakers odds-on favourite for the vacant Leicester City job.","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-could-help-30458046","content":"Ruud van Nistelrooy could help Manchester United complete four transfers amid new job talk - Amie Wilson - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                    

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

Ruud van Nistelrooy could help Manchester United complete four transfers amid new job talk
==========================================================================================

The latest Manchester United transfer news and opinion as the former striker is the bookmakers odds-on favourite for the vacant Leicester City job.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments3](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-could-help-30458046#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

[Amie Wilson](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/amie-wilson/)

*   19:30, 26 NOV 2024
*   Updated19:34, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Ruud van Nistelrooy during the UEFA Europa League 2024/25 League Phase MD4 match between Manchester United and PAOK FC at Old Trafford.](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article30458094.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Manchester-United-v-PAOK-FC-UEFA-Europa-League-202425-League-Phase-MD4.jpg)

Ruud van Nisterooy is odds-on favourite to take over at Leicester City following his exit from Manchester United. (Image: Naomi Baker/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

There has been a lot of talk over the future of [Ruud van Nistelrooy](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruud-van-nistelrooy) since his [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) exit just a couple of weeks ago.

The former striker returned to United in the summer as assistant to [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag). The manager’s sacking in October led to van Nistelrooy taking interim charge of the club.

In his four games in charge, United won three and drew one. Two of those wins came against Leicester City - a 5-2 Carabao Cup victory and a 3-0 win in the Premier League.

The appointment of [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) led to uncertainty over van Nistelrooy’s future, and it was announced on the new head coach’s first day at the club that he would be leaving. It now seems that [van Nistelrooy is set for a quick return to coaching](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-next-job-30450187).

**READ MORE: [New Man United financial figures highlight major issue INEOS have to solve](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/new-man-united-financial-figures-30457666)**

**READ MORE: [Sir Alex Ferguson made me promise when I joined Man United - he broke it for Liverpool](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/alex-ferguson-liverpool-man-utd-30457621)**

Following the sacking of Steve Cooper, the Dutchman is currently odds-on favourite to take over at Leicester. If it does happen, a reunion withe United will be on the cards in March when they travel to the King Power Stadium.

Van Nistelrooy;s relationship with United could potentially benefit both clubs, especially with the January transfer window not far away. With that in mind, here are four United players that the former coach could potentially sign with his new club.

#### Harry Maguire

The centre-back’s time at United looks to be coming to an end, so could a return to his former club be a possibility? Maguire joined United from Leiceter in the summer of 2019 for a fee of £80 million after two successful seasons at the club, where he also established himself as an England regular.

The 31-year-old has just six months remaining on his contract at Old Trafford. So he can either be sold for a reduced fee in January, or move on for nothing in the summer.

Leicester do have Conor Coady and Jannik Vestergaard as the more experienced centre-back options, but could turn to Maguire if they want to add to their backline.

#### Toby Collyer

The 20-year-old has broken into the squad this season, making an appearance in the second half of the 3-0 defeat against Liverpool back in September. He has however, struggled for appearances since then and has not made the squad in the last seven Premier League games.

A loan move for more game time, and if that could come with a Premier League club like Leicester, then all the better. The Foxes do however have both of their loan slots taken up, it would mean that they would have to either send back or arrange a permanent deal for the two players currently on loan to do another temporary deal.

#### Antony

Antony has failed to live up to his price tag at United since making the move from Ajax in 2022. United paid an initial £82 million fee to bring him to Old Trafford.

It has however been rumoured that they could look to move the winger on in the upcoming transfer window. To do that, it will either have to be for a greatly reduced price, or on a loan deal.

If United could send him on loan to a fellow Premier League club and he refinds his form and confidence. His return would either help him start again at the club, or increase his asking price in the summer window.

#### Ethan Wheatley

Leicester are expected to be on the lookout for another forward in the January window, and that could be the case even more if van Nistelrooy is in charge. If they have a loan slot available, then on possibility could be young United striker Ethan Wheatley.

He has been named in the squad for the Europa League games against Fenerbahce and PAOK, as well as Premier League matches against Liverpool, Southampton, Brentford, West Ham and Chelsea.

The chance to work with van Nistelrooy again as well as getting more Premier League experience could be invaluable for the youngster as he looks to break into the United first team.

Man United icon Cristiano Ronaldo sends Elon Musk eight-word message after 'big' win
====================================================================================

Elon Musk congratulated former Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo after Al Nassr won their fourth consecutive AFC Champions League match
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Share

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-united-icon-cristiano-ronaldo-30458152#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Matthew Abbott](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/matthew-abbott/)

*   18:15, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Cristiano Ronaldo during an Al-Nassr match](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30458125.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186821038.jpg)

Cristiano Ronaldo has engaged with Elon Musk on his social media platform X (Image: Yasser Bakhsh/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Elon Musk congratulated Cristiano Ronaldo after Al Nassr's latest win in the AFC [Champions League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/uefa-champions-league) Elite, and the former [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) player has now responded.

[Ronaldo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/cristiano-ronaldo), 39, scored twice for the Saudi Pro League side as they beat Qatar Stars League side Al Gharafa away in Al Rayyan. Former [Newcastle United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/newcastle-united-fc) and [Stoke City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/stoke-city-fc) striker Joselu, who spent last season on loan at Real Madrid, scored a consolation for the hosts after the brace and a goal from the one-time [Chelsea](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/chelsea-fc) winger Angelo Gabriel.

Ronaldo shared a photo of himself and the latter doing his _Siu_ celebration during the match on the social media platform Musk owns, X, formerly [Twitter](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/twitter), afterwards. Eight minutes after posting, "Big win tonight!" Musk replied.

"Congrats!" the businessman wrote, to which Ronaldo eventually responded approaching 20 hours later: "@elonmusk … Glad your eyes have time for good “soccer”"

He punctuated that response with a grinning face emoji and a flexed biceps emoji. The original post has over 68 million views, and Ronaldo has almost 114 million followers on the website, some 100 million less than Musk's 206 million.

The win comes three days after Al Nassr lost for the first time in the Saudi Pro League this season at home to Al Qadisiyah. Despite taking the lead through Ronaldo, the Mexico international Julian Quinones equalised before former [Arsenal](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/arsenal-fc) captain Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang scored what proved to be the winning goal.

Al Nassr has won just one of its last five domestic matches. They also drew with Al Hilal and Al Kholood and were knocked out of the King Cup of Champions by Al Taawoun.

However, they have now qualified for the Champions League knockout stages with three games to spare. They sit second in the West Region table - all three Saudi sides occupy the top three places.

data: {"title":"Man Utd icon Cristiano Ronaldo sends Elon Musk eight-word message after win","description":"Elon Musk congratulated former Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo after Al Nassr won their fourth consecutive AFC Champions League match","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-united-icon-cristiano-ronaldo-30458152","content":"Man United icon Cristiano Ronaldo sends Elon Musk eight-word message after 'big' win - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                   

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Man United icon Cristiano Ronaldo sends Elon Musk eight-word message after 'big' win
====================================================================================

Elon Musk congratulated former Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo after Al Nassr won their fourth consecutive AFC Champions League match
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-united-icon-cristiano-ronaldo-30458152#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Matthew Abbott](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/matthew-abbott/)

*   18:15, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Cristiano Ronaldo during an Al-Nassr match](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30458125.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186821038.jpg)

Cristiano Ronaldo has engaged with Elon Musk on his social media platform X (Image: Yasser Bakhsh/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Elon Musk congratulated Cristiano Ronaldo after Al Nassr's latest win in the AFC [Champions League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/uefa-champions-league) Elite, and the former [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) player has now responded.

[Ronaldo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/cristiano-ronaldo), 39, scored twice for the Saudi Pro League side as they beat Qatar Stars League side Al Gharafa away in Al Rayyan. Former [Newcastle United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/newcastle-united-fc) and [Stoke City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/stoke-city-fc) striker Joselu, who spent last season on loan at Real Madrid, scored a consolation for the hosts after the brace and a goal from the one-time [Chelsea](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/chelsea-fc) winger Angelo Gabriel.

Ronaldo shared a photo of himself and the latter doing his _Siu_ celebration during the match on the social media platform Musk owns, X, formerly [Twitter](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/twitter), afterwards. Eight minutes after posting, "Big win tonight!" Musk replied.

"Congrats!" the businessman wrote, to which Ronaldo eventually responded approaching 20 hours later: "@elonmusk … Glad your eyes have time for good “soccer”"

> [@elonmusk](https://twitter.com/elonmusk?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw) … Glad your eyes have time for good “soccer”
> 
> — Cristiano Ronaldo (@Cristiano) [November 26, 2024](https://twitter.com/Cristiano/status/1861444000638472559?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

He punctuated that response with a grinning face emoji and a flexed biceps emoji. The original post has over 68 million views, and Ronaldo has almost 114 million followers on the website, some 100 million less than Musk's 206 million.

The win comes three days after Al Nassr lost for the first time in the Saudi Pro League this season at home to Al Qadisiyah. Despite taking the lead through Ronaldo, the Mexico international Julian Quinones equalised before former [Arsenal](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/arsenal-fc) captain Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang scored what proved to be the winning goal.

Al Nassr has won just one of its last five domestic matches. They also drew with Al Hilal and Al Kholood and were knocked out of the King Cup of Champions by Al Taawoun.

However, they have now qualified for the Champions League knockout stages with three games to spare. They sit second in the West Region table - all three Saudi sides occupy the top three places.

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Elon Musk congratulated Cristiano Ronaldo after Al Nassr's latest win in the AFC [Champions League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/uefa-champions-league) Elite, and the former [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) player has now responded.

[Ronaldo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/cristiano-ronaldo), 39, scored twice for the Saudi Pro League side as they beat Qatar Stars League side Al Gharafa away in Al Rayyan. Former [Newcastle United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/newcastle-united-fc) and [Stoke City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/stoke-city-fc) striker Joselu, who spent last season on loan at Real Madrid, scored a consolation for the hosts after the brace and a goal from the one-time [Chelsea](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/chelsea-fc) winger Angelo Gabriel.

Ronaldo shared a photo of himself and the latter doing his _Siu_ celebration during the match on the social media platform Musk owns, X, formerly [Twitter](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/twitter), afterwards. Eight minutes after posting, "Big win tonight!" Musk replied.

"Congrats!" the businessman wrote, to which Ronaldo eventually responded approaching 20 hours later: "@elonmusk … Glad your eyes have time for good “soccer”"

> [@elonmusk](https://twitter.com/elonmusk?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw) … Glad your eyes have time for good “soccer”
> 
> — Cristiano Ronaldo (@Cristiano) [November 26, 2024](https://twitter.com/Cristiano/status/1861444000638472559?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

He punctuated that response with a grinning face emoji and a flexed biceps emoji. The original post has over 68 million views, and Ronaldo has almost 114 million followers on the website, some 100 million less than Musk's 206 million.

The win comes three days after Al Nassr lost for the first time in the Saudi Pro League this season at home to Al Qadisiyah. Despite taking the lead through Ronaldo, the Mexico international Julian Quinones equalised before former [Arsenal](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/arsenal-fc) captain Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang scored what proved to be the winning goal.

Al Nassr has won just one of its last five domestic matches. They also drew with Al Hilal and Al Kholood and were knocked out of the King Cup of Champions by Al Taawoun.

However, they have now qualified for the Champions League knockout stages with three games to spare. They sit second in the West Region table - all three Saudi sides occupy the top three places.

Man United icon Cristiano Ronaldo sends Elon Musk eight-word message after 'big' win
====================================================================================

Elon Musk congratulated former Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo after Al Nassr won their fourth consecutive AFC Champions League match
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*

By

[Matthew Abbott](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/matthew-abbott/)

*   18:15, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Cristiano Ronaldo during an Al-Nassr match](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30458125.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186821038.jpg)

Cristiano Ronaldo has engaged with Elon Musk on his social media platform X (Image: Yasser Bakhsh/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Elon Musk congratulated Cristiano Ronaldo after Al Nassr's latest win in the AFC [Champions League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/uefa-champions-league) Elite, and the former [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) player has now responded.

[Ronaldo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/cristiano-ronaldo), 39, scored twice for the Saudi Pro League side as they beat Qatar Stars League side Al Gharafa away in Al Rayyan. Former [Newcastle United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/newcastle-united-fc) and [Stoke City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/stoke-city-fc) striker Joselu, who spent last season on loan at Real Madrid, scored a consolation for the hosts after the brace and a goal from the one-time [Chelsea](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/chelsea-fc) winger Angelo Gabriel.

Ronaldo shared a photo of himself and the latter doing his _Siu_ celebration during the match on the social media platform Musk owns, X, formerly [Twitter](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/twitter), afterwards. Eight minutes after posting, "Big win tonight!" Musk replied.

"Congrats!" the businessman wrote, to which Ronaldo eventually responded approaching 20 hours later: "@elonmusk … Glad your eyes have time for good “soccer”"

He punctuated that response with a grinning face emoji and a flexed biceps emoji. The original post has over 68 million views, and Ronaldo has almost 114 million followers on the website, some 100 million less than Musk's 206 million.

The win comes three days after Al Nassr lost for the first time in the Saudi Pro League this season at home to Al Qadisiyah. Despite taking the lead through Ronaldo, the Mexico international Julian Quinones equalised before former [Arsenal](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/arsenal-fc) captain Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang scored what proved to be the winning goal.

Al Nassr has won just one of its last five domestic matches. They also drew with Al Hilal and Al Kholood and were knocked out of the King Cup of Champions by Al Taawoun.

However, they have now qualified for the Champions League knockout stages with three games to spare. They sit second in the West Region table - all three Saudi sides occupy the top three places.

'Adaptable' - Gary Neville names four Manchester United players who will be key for Ruben Amorim
================================================================================================

Gary Neville is confident certain players will thrive under new Man United head coach Ruben Amorim.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

By

[George Smith](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/george-smith/)Senior Football Writer

*   11:00, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Gary Neville appears on Sky Sports from his home via a video call.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30452529.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Screenshot-2024-11-26-at-102150.png)

Gary Neville has picked the bones out of Ruben Amorim's first game in charge. (Image: Sky Sports.)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

Gary Neville believes Luke Shaw is a "certainty" to become a key figure under Ruben Amorim, insisting those who are "adaptable" will blossom under the new [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) head coach.

The England international made his long-awaited comeback from injury in Sunday's 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town at Portman Road, stepping off the bench 11 minutes into the second half.

It marked his first appearance of any kind since England's 2-1 defeat to Spain in the European Championship final in July and his first in United colours since February.

**READ MORE:** **[United make Chido Obi-Martin decision ahead of European fixture](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-make-chido-obi-30451403)**

**READ MORE:** **[United can start their Ruben Amorim rebuild by releasing three players](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-can-start-ruben-30445109)**

He slotted into the left-sided centre-back berth after replacing [Jonny Evans](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/jonny-evans). United were light on centre-back options at Portman Road, missing Leny Yoro, [Lisandro Martinez](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/lisandro-martinez) and Harry Maguire.

Amorim, as expected, deployed a 3-4-3 formation, meaning he will need to be able to rely on his centre-backs to fill those three spaces in defence. And for [Neville](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/gary-neville), he believes Shaw and Yoro could be among the biggest winners of his appointment, likewise midfield duo Manuel Ugarte and [Kobbie Mainoo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/kobbie-mainoo), neither of whom started on Sunday.

"Luke Shaw, if he can keep fit \[will be a winner\]," said Neville, speaking to Sky Sports. "As I think that left centre-back needs to eventually be able to play out as a left-back, so he is well suited to do both. The same must be said of the right centre-back.

"We saw \[Noussair\] Mazraoui do it against Ipswich. I think Ugarte will be a winner, just because I think in midfield, not just because he's played for him before.

"I think it's how you fit in the likes of \[Marcus\] Rashford, \[Alejandro\] Garnacho, Bruno Fernandes. Because one thing you know with that system, you've got two wing-backs, you've got a back-three and you've got a two in front.

"It's then that three, which obviously the two that he likes to play sort of come inside a little bit. So, you're wondering about sort of Amad... Amad played obviously wide yesterday, but Garnacho, Rashford, \[Rasmus\] Hojlund, \[Joshua\] Zirkzee, Fernandes. That's the conundrum of those attacking positions where I can't quite see what's going to happen.

"I think Mainoo and Ugarte for me, playing midfield, I think they're absolute certs. I think Luke Shaw's a certainty to play. I think he would be anyway in a back four or a back three.

"I think ultimately you'll end up with Yoro as the right-centre-back, I think just because of that energy and that pace. So, I think the winners will be the ones who I think are adaptable."

data: {"title":"'Adaptable' - Gary Neville names four Man Utd stars who will be key for Amorim","description":"Gary Neville is confident certain players will thrive under new Man United head coach Ruben Amorim.","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/adaptable-gary-neville-names-four-30452462","content":"'Adaptable' - Gary Neville names four Manchester United players who will be key for Ruben Amorim - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                  

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

'Adaptable' - Gary Neville names four Manchester United players who will be key for Ruben Amorim
================================================================================================

Gary Neville is confident certain players will thrive under new Man United head coach Ruben Amorim.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments3](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/adaptable-gary-neville-names-four-30452462#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[George Smith](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/george-smith/)Senior Football Writer

*   11:00, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Gary Neville appears on Sky Sports from his home via a video call.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30452529.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Screenshot-2024-11-26-at-102150.png)

Gary Neville has picked the bones out of Ruben Amorim's first game in charge. (Image: Sky Sports.)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Gary Neville believes Luke Shaw is a "certainty" to become a key figure under Ruben Amorim, insisting those who are "adaptable" will blossom under the new [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) head coach.

The England international made his long-awaited comeback from injury in Sunday's 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town at Portman Road, stepping off the bench 11 minutes into the second half.

It marked his first appearance of any kind since England's 2-1 defeat to Spain in the European Championship final in July and his first in United colours since February.

**READ MORE:** **[United make Chido Obi-Martin decision ahead of European fixture](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-make-chido-obi-30451403)**

**READ MORE:** **[United can start their Ruben Amorim rebuild by releasing three players](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-can-start-ruben-30445109)**

He slotted into the left-sided centre-back berth after replacing [Jonny Evans](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/jonny-evans). United were light on centre-back options at Portman Road, missing Leny Yoro, [Lisandro Martinez](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/lisandro-martinez) and Harry Maguire.

Amorim, as expected, deployed a 3-4-3 formation, meaning he will need to be able to rely on his centre-backs to fill those three spaces in defence. And for [Neville](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/gary-neville), he believes Shaw and Yoro could be among the biggest winners of his appointment, likewise midfield duo Manuel Ugarte and [Kobbie Mainoo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/kobbie-mainoo), neither of whom started on Sunday.

"Luke Shaw, if he can keep fit \[will be a winner\]," said Neville, speaking to Sky Sports. "As I think that left centre-back needs to eventually be able to play out as a left-back, so he is well suited to do both. The same must be said of the right centre-back.

"We saw \[Noussair\] Mazraoui do it against Ipswich. I think Ugarte will be a winner, just because I think in midfield, not just because he's played for him before.

"I think it's how you fit in the likes of \[Marcus\] Rashford, \[Alejandro\] Garnacho, Bruno Fernandes. Because one thing you know with that system, you've got two wing-backs, you've got a back-three and you've got a two in front.

"It's then that three, which obviously the two that he likes to play sort of come inside a little bit. So, you're wondering about sort of Amad... Amad played obviously wide yesterday, but Garnacho, Rashford, \[Rasmus\] Hojlund, \[Joshua\] Zirkzee, Fernandes. That's the conundrum of those attacking positions where I can't quite see what's going to happen.

"I think Mainoo and Ugarte for me, playing midfield, I think they're absolute certs. I think Luke Shaw's a certainty to play. I think he would be anyway in a back four or a back three.

"I think ultimately you'll end up with Yoro as the right-centre-back, I think just because of that energy and that pace. So, I think the winners will be the ones who I think are adaptable."
