data: {"title":"'Adaptable' - Gary Neville names four Man Utd stars who will be key for Amorim","description":"Gary Neville is confident certain players will thrive under new Man United head coach Ruben Amorim.","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/adaptable-gary-neville-names-four-30452462","content":"'Adaptable' - Gary Neville names four Manchester United players who will be key for Ruben Amorim - Manchester Evening News
===============

'Adaptable' - Gary Neville names four Manchester United players who will be key for Ruben Amorim
================================================================================================

Gary Neville is confident certain players will thrive under new Man United head coach Ruben Amorim.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments3](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/adaptable-gary-neville-names-four-30452462#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[George Smith](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/george-smith/)Senior Football Writer

*   11:00, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Gary Neville appears on Sky Sports from his home via a video call.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30452529.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Screenshot-2024-11-26-at-102150.png)

Gary Neville has picked the bones out of Ruben Amorim's first game in charge. (Image: Sky Sports.)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Gary Neville believes Luke Shaw is a "certainty" to become a key figure under Ruben Amorim, insisting those who are "adaptable" will blossom under the new [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) head coach.

The England international made his long-awaited comeback from injury in Sunday's 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town at Portman Road, stepping off the bench 11 minutes into the second half.

It marked his first appearance of any kind since England's 2-1 defeat to Spain in the European Championship final in July and his first in United colours since February.

**READ MORE:** **[United make Chido Obi-Martin decision ahead of European fixture](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-make-chido-obi-30451403)**

**READ MORE:** **[United can start their Ruben Amorim rebuild by releasing three players](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-can-start-ruben-30445109)**

He slotted into the left-sided centre-back berth after replacing [Jonny Evans](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/jonny-evans). United were light on centre-back options at Portman Road, missing Leny Yoro, [Lisandro Martinez](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/lisandro-martinez) and Harry Maguire.

Amorim, as expected, deployed a 3-4-3 formation, meaning he will need to be able to rely on his centre-backs to fill those three spaces in defence. And for [Neville](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/gary-neville), he believes Shaw and Yoro could be among the biggest winners of his appointment, likewise midfield duo Manuel Ugarte and [Kobbie Mainoo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/kobbie-mainoo), neither of whom started on Sunday.

"Luke Shaw, if he can keep fit \[will be a winner\]," said Neville, speaking to Sky Sports. "As I think that left centre-back needs to eventually be able to play out as a left-back, so he is well suited to do both. The same must be said of the right centre-back.

"We saw \[Noussair\] Mazraoui do it against Ipswich. I think Ugarte will be a winner, just because I think in midfield, not just because he's played for him before.

"I think it's how you fit in the likes of \[Marcus\] Rashford, \[Alejandro\] Garnacho, Bruno Fernandes. Because one thing you know with that system, you've got two wing-backs, you've got a back-three and you've got a two in front.

"It's then that three, which obviously the two that he likes to play sort of come inside a little bit. So, you're wondering about sort of Amad... Amad played obviously wide yesterday, but Garnacho, Rashford, \[Rasmus\] Hojlund, \[Joshua\] Zirkzee, Fernandes. That's the conundrum of those attacking positions where I can't quite see what's going to happen.

"I think Mainoo and Ugarte for me, playing midfield, I think they're absolute certs. I think Luke Shaw's a certainty to play. I think he would be anyway in a back four or a back three.

"I think ultimately you'll end up with Yoro as the right-centre-back, I think just because of that energy and that pace. So, I think the winners will be the ones who I think are adaptable."

'Adaptable' - Gary Neville names four Manchester United players who will be key for Ruben Amorim
================================================================================================

Gary Neville is confident certain players will thrive under new Man United head coach Ruben Amorim.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments3](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/adaptable-gary-neville-names-four-30452462#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[George Smith](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/george-smith/)Senior Football Writer

*   11:00, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Gary Neville appears on Sky Sports from his home via a video call.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30452529.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Screenshot-2024-11-26-at-102150.png)

Gary Neville has picked the bones out of Ruben Amorim's first game in charge. (Image: Sky Sports.)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Gary Neville believes Luke Shaw is a "certainty" to become a key figure under Ruben Amorim, insisting those who are "adaptable" will blossom under the new [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) head coach.

The England international made his long-awaited comeback from injury in Sunday's 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town at Portman Road, stepping off the bench 11 minutes into the second half.

It marked his first appearance of any kind since England's 2-1 defeat to Spain in the European Championship final in July and his first in United colours since February.

**READ MORE:** **[United make Chido Obi-Martin decision ahead of European fixture](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-make-chido-obi-30451403)**

**READ MORE:** **[United can start their Ruben Amorim rebuild by releasing three players](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-can-start-ruben-30445109)**

He slotted into the left-sided centre-back berth after replacing [Jonny Evans](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/jonny-evans). United were light on centre-back options at Portman Road, missing Leny Yoro, [Lisandro Martinez](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/lisandro-martinez) and Harry Maguire.

Amorim, as expected, deployed a 3-4-3 formation, meaning he will need to be able to rely on his centre-backs to fill those three spaces in defence. And for [Neville](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/gary-neville), he believes Shaw and Yoro could be among the biggest winners of his appointment, likewise midfield duo Manuel Ugarte and [Kobbie Mainoo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/kobbie-mainoo), neither of whom started on Sunday.

"Luke Shaw, if he can keep fit \[will be a winner\]," said Neville, speaking to Sky Sports. "As I think that left centre-back needs to eventually be able to play out as a left-back, so he is well suited to do both. The same must be said of the right centre-back.

"We saw \[Noussair\] Mazraoui do it against Ipswich. I think Ugarte will be a winner, just because I think in midfield, not just because he's played for him before.

"I think it's how you fit in the likes of \[Marcus\] Rashford, \[Alejandro\] Garnacho, Bruno Fernandes. Because one thing you know with that system, you've got two wing-backs, you've got a back-three and you've got a two in front.

"It's then that three, which obviously the two that he likes to play sort of come inside a little bit. So, you're wondering about sort of Amad... Amad played obviously wide yesterday, but Garnacho, Rashford, \[Rasmus\] Hojlund, \[Joshua\] Zirkzee, Fernandes. That's the conundrum of those attacking positions where I can't quite see what's going to happen.

"I think Mainoo and Ugarte for me, playing midfield, I think they're absolute certs. I think Luke Shaw's a certainty to play. I think he would be anyway in a back four or a back three.

"I think ultimately you'll end up with Yoro as the right-centre-back, I think just because of that energy and that pace. So, I think the winners will be the ones who I think are adaptable."

Erik ten Hag's Manchester United legacy to Ruben Amorim speaks volumes
======================================================================

Manchester United's new era under Ruben Amorim began with a 1-1 draw at Ipswich Town where the new 3-4-3 system was debuted
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

By

![Image 1: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30450440.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186664130.jpg)

Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim (Image: Richard Pelham/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United have been told to write this season off after a historically poor start to the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) under Erik ten Hag.

[The Dutchman](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) was fired by Ineos on October 28 following a 2-1 defeat at West Ham United. After he left [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) on the Monday, [the Reds](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) wasted little time finding his successor with Ruben Amorim appointed the following Friday.

Due to an agreement with Sporting Lisbon, [Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) did not begin work at Old Trafford until Monday, November 11 - the start of the final international break of the year. As such, his first match in charge of the club came on Sunday when United drew 1-1 at Ipswich Town despite taking the lead inside 90 seconds.

**READ MORE: [Amorim is working on three United weaknesses during warm-ups](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-working-manchester-uniteds-30442813)**

**READ MORE: [United have new contender for key Amorim role](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-new-contender-key-30444877)**

Of course, it will take longer than one match to implement a new style on this United team but former Arsenal winger Theo Walcott believes the Reds need to let this season go particularly with such a relentless run of games between now and the new year. He told [Sky Sports' Monday Night Football](https://www.skysports.com/): "That \[implementing a new season\] is the difficulty he is going to have at this part of the season.

"The November/December period before [Christmas](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/christmas) is for me always an interesting time where it is all about recovery for the players. I think at times now, the players are just going to have to get on with it and need to learn really quickly.

"They will do a lot of walkthrough, I would have thought, but they need to get in the habits, plant the seed which will be repetition, repetition just to adapt to the system. They will have to learn very quickly but I think as well, they need to just write off this season.

"It has been a long time \[of pain\] for [Man United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) and they are going to have to accept that as they have got the man they want now. But, how long will they stay in this system particularly when they want to get results?"

Erik ten Hag's Manchester United legacy to Ruben Amorim speaks volumes
======================================================================

Manchester United's new era under Ruben Amorim began with a 1-1 draw at Ipswich Town where the new 3-4-3 system was debuted
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/erik-ten-hags-manchester-united-30450414#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Jack Flintham](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/jack-flintham/)Sport Central Audience Writer

*   09:45, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30450440.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186664130.jpg)

Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim (Image: Richard Pelham/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United have been told to write this season off after a historically poor start to the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) under Erik ten Hag.

[The Dutchman](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) was fired by Ineos on October 28 following a 2-1 defeat at West Ham United. After he left [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) on the Monday, [the Reds](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) wasted little time finding his successor with Ruben Amorim appointed the following Friday.

Due to an agreement with Sporting Lisbon, [Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) did not begin work at Old Trafford until Monday, November 11 - the start of the final international break of the year. As such, his first match in charge of the club came on Sunday when United drew 1-1 at Ipswich Town despite taking the lead inside 90 seconds.

**READ MORE: [Amorim is working on three United weaknesses during warm-ups](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-working-manchester-uniteds-30442813)**

**READ MORE: [United have new contender for key Amorim role](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-new-contender-key-30444877)**

Of course, it will take longer than one match to implement a new style on this United team but former Arsenal winger Theo Walcott believes the Reds need to let this season go particularly with such a relentless run of games between now and the new year. He told [Sky Sports' Monday Night Football](https://www.skysports.com/): "That \[implementing a new season\] is the difficulty he is going to have at this part of the season.

"The November/December period before [Christmas](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/christmas) is for me always an interesting time where it is all about recovery for the players. I think at times now, the players are just going to have to get on with it and need to learn really quickly.

"They will do a lot of walkthrough, I would have thought, but they need to get in the habits, plant the seed which will be repetition, repetition just to adapt to the system. They will have to learn very quickly but I think as well, they need to just write off this season.

"It has been a long time \[of pain\] for [Man United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) and they are going to have to accept that as they have got the man they want now. But, how long will they stay in this system particularly when they want to get results?"

===============
                                   

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Erik ten Hag's Manchester United legacy to Ruben Amorim speaks volumes
======================================================================

Manchester United's new era under Ruben Amorim began with a 1-1 draw at Ipswich Town where the new 3-4-3 system was debuted
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/erik-ten-hags-manchester-united-30450414#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Jack Flintham](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/jack-flintham/)Sport Central Audience Writer

*   09:45, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30450440.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186664130.jpg)

Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim (Image: Richard Pelham/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United have been told to write this season off after a historically poor start to the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) under Erik ten Hag.

[The Dutchman](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) was fired by Ineos on October 28 following a 2-1 defeat at West Ham United. After he left [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) on the Monday, [the Reds](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) wasted little time finding his successor with Ruben Amorim appointed the following Friday.

Due to an agreement with Sporting Lisbon, [Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) did not begin work at Old Trafford until Monday, November 11 - the start of the final international break of the year. As such, his first match in charge of the club came on Sunday when United drew 1-1 at Ipswich Town despite taking the lead inside 90 seconds.

**READ MORE: [Amorim is working on three United weaknesses during warm-ups](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-working-manchester-uniteds-30442813)**

**READ MORE: [United have new contender for key Amorim role](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-new-contender-key-30444877)**

Of course, it will take longer than one match to implement a new style on this United team but former Arsenal winger Theo Walcott believes the Reds need to let this season go particularly with such a relentless run of games between now and the new year. He told [Sky Sports' Monday Night Football](https://www.skysports.com/): "That \[implementing a new season\] is the difficulty he is going to have at this part of the season.

"The November/December period before [Christmas](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/christmas) is for me always an interesting time where it is all about recovery for the players. I think at times now, the players are just going to have to get on with it and need to learn really quickly.

"They will do a lot of walkthrough, I would have thought, but they need to get in the habits, plant the seed which will be repetition, repetition just to adapt to the system. They will have to learn very quickly but I think as well, they need to just write off this season.

"It has been a long time \[of pain\] for [Man United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) and they are going to have to accept that as they have got the man they want now. But, how long will they stay in this system particularly when they want to get results?"

===============
                                   

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Erik ten Hag's Manchester United legacy to Ruben Amorim speaks volumes
======================================================================

Manchester United's new era under Ruben Amorim began with a 1-1 draw at Ipswich Town where the new 3-4-3 system was debuted
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/erik-ten-hags-manchester-united-30450414#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Jack Flintham](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/jack-flintham/)Sport Central Audience Writer

*   09:45, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30450440.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186664130.jpg)

Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim (Image: Richard Pelham/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United have been told to write this season off after a historically poor start to the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) under Erik ten Hag.

[The Dutchman](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) was fired by Ineos on October 28 following a 2-1 defeat at West Ham United. After he left [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) on the Monday, [the Reds](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) wasted little time finding his successor with Ruben Amorim appointed the following Friday.

Due to an agreement with Sporting Lisbon, [Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) did not begin work at Old Trafford until Monday, November 11 - the start of the final international break of the year. As such, his first match in charge of the club came on Sunday when United drew 1-1 at Ipswich Town despite taking the lead inside 90 seconds.

**READ MORE: [Amorim is working on three United weaknesses during warm-ups](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-working-manchester-uniteds-30442813)**

**READ MORE: [United have new contender for key Amorim role](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-new-contender-key-30444877)**

Of course, it will take longer than one match to implement a new style on this United team but former Arsenal winger Theo Walcott believes the Reds need to let this season go particularly with such a relentless run of games between now and the new year. He told [Sky Sports' Monday Night Football](https://www.skysports.com/): "That \[implementing a new season\] is the difficulty he is going to have at this part of the season.

"The November/December period before [Christmas](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/christmas) is for me always an interesting time where it is all about recovery for the players. I think at times now, the players are just going to have to get on with it and need to learn really quickly.

"They will do a lot of walkthrough, I would have thought, but they need to get in the habits, plant the seed which will be repetition, repetition just to adapt to the system. They will have to learn very quickly but I think as well, they need to just write off this season.

"It has been a long time \[of pain\] for [Man United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) and they are going to have to accept that as they have got the man they want now. But, how long will they stay in this system particularly when they want to get results?"

Erik ten Hag's Manchester United legacy to Ruben Amorim speaks volumes
======================================================================

Manchester United's new era under Ruben Amorim began with a 1-1 draw at Ipswich Town where the new 3-4-3 system was debuted
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/erik-ten-hags-manchester-united-30450414#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Jack Flintham](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/jack-flintham/)Sport Central Audience Writer

*   09:45, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30450440.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186664130.jpg)

Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim (Image: Richard Pelham/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United have been told to write this season off after a historically poor start to the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) under Erik ten Hag.

[The Dutchman](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) was fired by Ineos on October 28 following a 2-1 defeat at West Ham United. After he left [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) on the Monday, [the Reds](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) wasted little time finding his successor with Ruben Amorim appointed the following Friday.

Due to an agreement with Sporting Lisbon, [Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) did not begin work at Old Trafford until Monday, November 11 - the start of the final international break of the year. As such, his first match in charge of the club came on Sunday when United drew 1-1 at Ipswich Town despite taking the lead inside 90 seconds.

**READ MORE: [Amorim is working on three United weaknesses during warm-ups](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-working-manchester-uniteds-30442813)**

**READ MORE: [United have new contender for key Amorim role](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-new-contender-key-30444877)**

Of course, it will take longer than one match to implement a new style on this United team but former Arsenal winger Theo Walcott believes the Reds need to let this season go particularly with such a relentless run of games between now and the new year. He told [Sky Sports' Monday Night Football](https://www.skysports.com/): "That \[implementing a new season\] is the difficulty he is going to have at this part of the season.

"The November/December period before [Christmas](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/christmas) is for me always an interesting time where it is all about recovery for the players. I think at times now, the players are just going to have to get on with it and need to learn really quickly.

"They will do a lot of walkthrough, I would have thought, but they need to get in the habits, plant the seed which will be repetition, repetition just to adapt to the system. They will have to learn very quickly but I think as well, they need to just write off this season.

"It has been a long time \[of pain\] for [Man United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) and they are going to have to accept that as they have got the man they want now. But, how long will they stay in this system particularly when they want to get results?"

data: {"title":"Viktor Gyokeres has finally 'made up his mind' on the club he wants to join in blockbuster transfer","description":"Viktor Gyokeres has been linked with a move away from Sporting Clube de Portugal.","url":"https://www.sportbible.com/football/transfer-news/viktor-gyokeres-sporting-transfer-news-274064-20241126","content":"Viktor Gyokeres has finally 'made up his mind' on the club he wants to join in blockbuster transfer - Transfer News - SPORTbible
===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**Sporting Clube de Portugal star man Viktor Gyokeres has reportedly decided his next club.**

Gyokeres is one of the most sought-after players in Europe after yet another fine start to the season.

So far, the Swedish international has scored 24 goals in 19 appearances across all competitions. The 26-year-old also has four assists to his name.

As a result of his spectacular form, Gyokeres has been linked with a host of different clubs around the continent, including the likes of Manchester United, Liverpool, Arsenal, Chelsea, Paris Saint Germain and Barcelona.

Advert

However, since Ruben Amorim left Sporting for Old Trafford, reports linking Gyokeres with a move to [United](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-united) have picked up.

It has now been claimed that the striker has made up his mind on which club he wants to join in the future.

As [reported](https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/31946840/arsenal-barcelona-make-isak-transfer-target-gyokeres-man-utd/) by The Sun, Gyokeres has his eyes set on a move to Old Trafford, in what would be a reunion with former boss [Amorim](https://www.sportbible.com/ruben-amorim).

The report stated: "SunSport understands Sporting Lisbon striker Gyokeres has his heart set on a move to the Premier League and a reunion with ex-boss Ruben Amorim at Manchester United."

Advert

![Image 1: Viktor Gyokeres has been linked with a move to the Premier League. Image](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/bltea6c744748278d4f/674600d15f42e681c4496cfc/GettyImages-2185446637.jpg)

Getty

Before joining United, Amorim was asked about potentially reuniting with Gyokeres at Old Trafford.

The Portuguese said: "No, no, no. I cannot be funny with that in this moment. It was tough for me to leave, if I start joking about that with Gyokeres, I’ll have problems. This is my city, this is my country, I will respect.

"Viktor has to stay until the end of the season and then his life is going, maybe, somewhere else."

Advert

When asked about about Amorim, Gyokeres himself said: "We will miss him a lot, of course.

"We achieved a lot together and we will miss him and the other members of the staff, but they are leaving and we have to move on and face the next challenge we have."

Gyokeres is set to start for Sporting as they resume their UEFA Champions League campaign against Arsenal at the Estadio Jose Alvalade on Tuesday night.

===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**Manchester United have made a 'serious' move for one of the biggest talents in Serie A, according to reports in Italy.**

[United](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-united)'s new head coach [Ruben Amorim](https://www.sportbible.com/ruben-amorim) is looking to make his mark at Old Trafford after officially joining from Portuguese club [Sporting](https://www.google.com/search?q=sporting+sportbible&rlz=1C5GCEM_en&oq=sporting+sportbible&gs_lcrp=EgZjaHJvbWUqBggAEEUYOzIGCAAQRRg7MhMIARAuGIMBGMcBGLEDGNEDGIAEMhAIAhAuGMcBGLEDGNEDGIAEMg0IAxAAGIMBGLEDGIAEMhMIBBAuGIMBGMcBGLEDGNEDGIAEMgYIBRBFGDwyBggGEEUYPDIGCAcQRRg80gEIMTQ4OWowajSoAgCwAgA&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8) earlier this month.

He got his first taste of competitive action with United on Sunday [as they were held to a 1-1 draw by Ipswich Town](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/ruben-amorim-man-united-ipswich-741509-20241125), a result which indicates the size of the task Amorim faces in transforming the club's fortunes this season.

Advert

The Red Devils are currently 12th in the Premier League, already 15 points behind league leaders Liverpool after just 12 games.

Amorim's predecessor Erik ten Hag spent more than £600m on new signings during his time as manager at United, leaving the Portuguese with a restricted transfer budget in January.

But that hasn't stopped the club targeting potential signings for the Portuguese.

Advert

Now, a sensational report in Italy claims United are lining up a move for [Napoli](https://www.sportbible.com/napoli) winger [Khvicha Kvaratskhelia](https://www.sportbible.com/khvicha-kvaratskhelia).

Italian outlet [Sportmediaset](https://www.getfootballnewsitaly.com/2024/manchester-united-serious-in-move-for-napolis-khvicha-kvaratskhelia/?utm_content=cmp-true) \[via [GetFootballNewsItaly](https://www.sportmediaset.mediaset.it/mercato/il-manchester-united-tenta-kvara-9-milioni-per-portarlo-in-premier_90734135-202402k.shtml)\] report that United are making a 'serious' move for the Georgia international, who has scored 30 goals and provided 28 assists in 103 games for Napoli.

Amorim is said to view him as a 'key target' for the inside forward role in his preferred 3-4-3 set-up.

Kvaratskhelia is out of contract in 2027 and Napoli are keen to tie him down to a new long-term deal.

Advert

The Serie A leaders are said to have offered him a €6m (£5.1m) contract to convince him to stay.

However, United are prepared to offer the player a €9m (£7.5m) deal, which Napoli would be unable to match.

The report adds that if Kvaratskhelia's future isn't resolved by the end of the season, Napoli could look to sell the winger – but a fee of around €100m (£83.4m) would be required to convince the Italian club to part ways.

![Image 1: United are said to have 'serious' interest in Kvaratskhelia (Image: Getty)](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blt842b65d38b92fbf6/6745ce70cd2448491516db31/GettyImages-2049889412.jpg)

United are said to have 'serious' interest in Kvaratskhelia (Image: Getty)

Advert

Kvaratskhelia has scored five goals in 15 games this season to help Napoli to the top of Serie A, where they are one point clear of four teams – Atalanta, Inter, Fiorentina and Lazio.

Speaking last year, Kvaratskhelia's former Napoli teammate Victor Osimhen tipped the Georgian to challenge for the Ballon d'Or in the coming seasons.

"He's a great guy, I understood that immediately," said Osimhen.

"Everyone loves him in the dressing room, not only for what he does on the pitch but also for what he does off the pitch.

Advert

"I believe he can win the Ballon d'Or in the next few years, I hope he also brings many successes to Napoli."

![Image 2: comment bubble](https://www.sportbible.com/_next/static/media/comment-bubble.c94d2633.svg)0 comments

===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**Manchester United have made a 'serious' move for one of the biggest talents in Serie A, according to reports in Italy.**

[United](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-united)'s new head coach [Ruben Amorim](https://www.sportbible.com/ruben-amorim) is looking to make his mark at Old Trafford after officially joining from Portuguese club [Sporting](https://www.google.com/search?q=sporting+sportbible&rlz=1C5GCEM_en&oq=sporting+sportbible&gs_lcrp=EgZjaHJvbWUqBggAEEUYOzIGCAAQRRg7MhMIARAuGIMBGMcBGLEDGNEDGIAEMhAIAhAuGMcBGLEDGNEDGIAEMg0IAxAAGIMBGLEDGIAEMhMIBBAuGIMBGMcBGLEDGNEDGIAEMgYIBRBFGDwyBggGEEUYPDIGCAcQRRg80gEIMTQ4OWowajSoAgCwAgA&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8) earlier this month.

He got his first taste of competitive action with United on Sunday [as they were held to a 1-1 draw by Ipswich Town](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/ruben-amorim-man-united-ipswich-741509-20241125), a result which indicates the size of the task Amorim faces in transforming the club's fortunes this season.

Advert

The Red Devils are currently 12th in the Premier League, already 15 points behind league leaders Liverpool after just 12 games.

Amorim's predecessor Erik ten Hag spent more than £600m on new signings during his time as manager at United, leaving the Portuguese with a restricted transfer budget in January.

But that hasn't stopped the club targeting potential signings for the Portuguese.

Advert

Now, a sensational report in Italy claims United are lining up a move for [Napoli](https://www.sportbible.com/napoli) winger [Khvicha Kvaratskhelia](https://www.sportbible.com/khvicha-kvaratskhelia).

Italian outlet [Sportmediaset](https://www.getfootballnewsitaly.com/2024/manchester-united-serious-in-move-for-napolis-khvicha-kvaratskhelia/?utm_content=cmp-true) \[via [GetFootballNewsItaly](https://www.sportmediaset.mediaset.it/mercato/il-manchester-united-tenta-kvara-9-milioni-per-portarlo-in-premier_90734135-202402k.shtml)\] report that United are making a 'serious' move for the Georgia international, who has scored 30 goals and provided 28 assists in 103 games for Napoli.

Amorim is said to view him as a 'key target' for the inside forward role in his preferred 3-4-3 set-up.

Kvaratskhelia is out of contract in 2027 and Napoli are keen to tie him down to a new long-term deal.

Advert

The Serie A leaders are said to have offered him a €6m (£5.1m) contract to convince him to stay.

However, United are prepared to offer the player a €9m (£7.5m) deal, which Napoli would be unable to match.

The report adds that if Kvaratskhelia's future isn't resolved by the end of the season, Napoli could look to sell the winger – but a fee of around €100m (£83.4m) would be required to convince the Italian club to part ways.

![Image 1: United are said to have 'serious' interest in Kvaratskhelia (Image: Getty)](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blt842b65d38b92fbf6/6745ce70cd2448491516db31/GettyImages-2049889412.jpg)

United are said to have 'serious' interest in Kvaratskhelia (Image: Getty)

Advert

Kvaratskhelia has scored five goals in 15 games this season to help Napoli to the top of Serie A, where they are one point clear of four teams – Atalanta, Inter, Fiorentina and Lazio.

Speaking last year, Kvaratskhelia's former Napoli teammate Victor Osimhen tipped the Georgian to challenge for the Ballon d'Or in the coming seasons.

"He's a great guy, I understood that immediately," said Osimhen.

data: {"title":"Ex-Spurs and Everton star Dele Alli suffers devastating blow as hopes of Premier League return take new hit","description":"He has been training with Everton ahead of a potential comeback.","url":"https://www.sportbible.com/football/premier-league/dele-alli-everton-premier-league-injury-england-728852-20241126","content":"Ex-Spurs and Everton star Dele Alli suffers devastating blow as hopes of Premier League return take new hit - Premier League - SPORTbible
===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**Dele Alli has suffered another setback in what could prove to be a damaging blow to his Everton future.**

The 28-year-old midfielder, who last played a competitive game of football in February 2023, returned to the Toffees in April after his loan spell was cut short at Besiktas.

In fact, he was close to returning for their pre-season campaign but after picking up further injuries – including a persistent groin issue in January that required surgery – his return was delayed.

Advert

Alli, who is currently a free agent after his contract at [Everton](https://www.sportbible.com/everton) expired at the end of June, is being allowed to train with the [Premier League](https://www.sportbible.com/premier-league) club as he continues his intensive rehabilitation programme.

Back in February, a report from [**The Athletic**](https://theathletic.com/5299868/2024/02/28/dele-everton-tottenham-injury-dyche/?source=emp_shared_article) suggests he was making 'positive progress' after being eager to repay the faith shown in him.

But now, the midfielder is set for another spell on the sidelines after he suffered a hamstring injury in training.

Advert

That's according to Everton insider [**El Bobble**](https://x.com/ElBobble/status/1861120692676071738), who wrote on X: "Dele, who remains out of contract at Everton, has suffered a hamstring setback in training."

The news comes just three weeks after Sky Sports editor [**Alan Myers**](https://x.com/ALANMYERSMEDIA) provided a positive update on [Alli](https://www.sportbible.com/dele-alli)'s progress at Finch Farm.

"I believe he’s all good and is closer to having some game time (U21’s) etc only what I’ve heard," said Myers.

Myers also claimed that a deal has been agreed in principle with the Toffees. "As far as I’m aware a deal has been agreed in principle but that will only kick in once he’s fit and ready to play," he added.

Advert

![Image 1: Dele Alli watches an Everton game. Image: Getty ](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blteba9517c5b1d492f/6729e9bf76886ce7225ba8e4/GettyImages-1609921992.jpg)

Dele Alli watches an Everton game. Image: Getty

Speaking to [**Sky Sports**](https://www.skysports.com/) last month, Everton manager [Sean Dyche](https://www.sportbible.com/sean-dyche) was asked about Alli's progress in training.

“Yeah he’s just getting back on the grass again, so building up again from another minor sort of injury," he said. “But unfortunately it cost him a bit more time and he’s just getting on with trying to get fit.”

Thoughts on Alli's future? Let us know in the comments.

![Image 2: comment bubble](https://www.sportbible.com/_next/static/media/comment-bubble.c94d2633.svg)0 comments

data: {"title":"Ex-Spurs and Everton star Dele Alli suffers devastating blow as hopes of Premier League return take new hit","description":"He has been training with Everton ahead of a potential comeback.","url":"https://www.sportbible.com/football/premier-league/dele-alli-everton-premier-league-injury-england-728852-20241126","content":"Ex-Spurs and Everton star Dele Alli suffers devastating blow as hopes of Premier League return take new hit - Premier League - SPORTbible
===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**Dele Alli has suffered another setback in what could prove to be a damaging blow to his Everton future.**

The 28-year-old midfielder, who last played a competitive game of football in February 2023, returned to the Toffees in April after his loan spell was cut short at Besiktas.

In fact, he was close to returning for their pre-season campaign but after picking up further injuries – including a persistent groin issue in January that required surgery – his return was delayed.

Advert

Alli, who is currently a free agent after his contract at [Everton](https://www.sportbible.com/everton) expired at the end of June, is being allowed to train with the [Premier League](https://www.sportbible.com/premier-league) club as he continues his intensive rehabilitation programme.

Back in February, a report from [**The Athletic**](https://theathletic.com/5299868/2024/02/28/dele-everton-tottenham-injury-dyche/?source=emp_shared_article) suggests he was making 'positive progress' after being eager to repay the faith shown in him.

But now, the midfielder is set for another spell on the sidelines after he suffered a hamstring injury in training.

Advert

That's according to Everton insider [**El Bobble**](https://x.com/ElBobble/status/1861120692676071738), who wrote on X: "Dele, who remains out of contract at Everton, has suffered a hamstring setback in training."

The news comes just three weeks after Sky Sports editor [**Alan Myers**](https://x.com/ALANMYERSMEDIA) provided a positive update on [Alli](https://www.sportbible.com/dele-alli)'s progress at Finch Farm.

"I believe he’s all good and is closer to having some game time (U21’s) etc only what I’ve heard," said Myers.

Myers also claimed that a deal has been agreed in principle with the Toffees. "As far as I’m aware a deal has been agreed in principle but that will only kick in once he’s fit and ready to play," he added.

Advert

![Image 1: Dele Alli watches an Everton game. Image: Getty ](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blteba9517c5b1d492f/6729e9bf76886ce7225ba8e4/GettyImages-1609921992.jpg)

Dele Alli watches an Everton game. Image: Getty

Speaking to [**Sky Sports**](https://www.skysports.com/) last month, Everton manager [Sean Dyche](https://www.sportbible.com/sean-dyche) was asked about Alli's progress in training.

“Yeah he’s just getting back on the grass again, so building up again from another minor sort of injury," he said. “But unfortunately it cost him a bit more time and he’s just getting on with trying to get fit.”

Thoughts on Alli's future? Let us know in the comments.

data: {"title":"Mark Goldbridge reveals he reached out to one Man Utd player after issues turned toxic","description":"The incident happened in November last year.","url":"https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/man-utd-premier-league-mark-goldbridge-united-stand-370460-20241126","content":"Mark Goldbridge reveals he reached out to one Man Utd player after issues turned toxic - Man Utd - SPORTbible
===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**Mark Goldbridge reached out to Marcus Rashford and his agent after the Manchester United forward asked YouTube channel The United Stand to "stop spreading malicious rumours" on social media.**

Back in November last year, [**The United Stand**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rgJbBjOetmc&ab_channel=TheUnitedStand) – a channel founded by Goldbridge – made a video with the title: 'Rashford Future In Doubt?'

"Given Rashford's injury against Fulham and his recent subpar performances, the question arises: should he still be a regular starter for [Manchester United](https://www.sportbible.com/man-utd)?" the video description read. "Furthermore, with [Amad](https://www.sportbible.com/amad-diallo) returning, will he be given playing time?"

Advert

The United Stand posted a link to the YouTube video on [**X**](https://x.com/UnitedStandMUFC/status/1721467212756558266), formerly Twitter, at 9:59am and around an hour later, [Rashford](https://www.sportbible.com/marcus-rashford) responded by saying: "Please STOP spreading malicious rumours."

Just over a year later and United fan [Goldbridge](https://www.sportbible.com/mark-goldbridge) was asked about Rashford's response during a guest appearance on YouTube channel [**Webby & O'Neill**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NWnvDVIe3Og&ab_channel=Webby%26O%27Neill).

Here's how the conversation played out between Tony O'Neill and Mark Goldbridge.

Advert

**O'Neill**: "I'm going to talk about a player here, it's very controversial, in many ways, with his form and off-field antics. But you caused a big stir, and he caused a bigger stir, when he reacted to your YouTube channel. And that's Marcus Rashford.

"He posted a comment on one of your tweets. He said: 'Please stop spreading malicious rumours.'

"Now for a player to come out, and accuse you of spreading lies... what was your reaction?"

![Image 1: Marcus Rashford left a comment on The United Stand's post. Image credit: YouTube/Webby & O'Neill](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blt4e6718bfa37fd358/6745bca564734a1633b20477/Screenshot_2024-11-26_at_12.14.47.png)

Marcus Rashford left a comment on The United Stand's post. Image credit: YouTube/Webby & O'Neill

Advert

**Goldbridge**: "It's disappointing. Ultimately, I would love to see Marcus Rashford play good football for Manchester United and score goals. That's all that matters. I don't really care what he's like as a person. That's the bottom line.

"But in relation to that situation, we tried to reach out to his agent but got nothing back, to sort of say, 'C'mon. This is a guy who is doing book deals and charity work, and you are replying to something that's out of context. Look at the s\*\*\*storm it has caused.

"I'd say 75 per cent of people are saying, 'Oh, go on Rashford, well done' but 25 per cent are going, 'What are you doing?'. I also said, we aren't The Sun or talkSPORT, have you looked at what they are saying today?

"All we said was, 'Is Rashford's future in doubt?' Is that malicious? He was playing awful at the time. Why go after The United Stand? Why not go after another YouTube channel or a website.

Advert

"Is was either really naive and silly, which is concerning, or calculated to cause us trouble. This is one of the biggest earners and reputation players at Manchester United and you're getting involved in a Twitter thing like that."

![Image 2: Image credit: Getty ](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blt2ca71775290a8a08/6745c79671787a0cd1c99186/GettyImages-1774345271.jpg)

Image credit: Getty

He added: "And if he is bothered, that's even more worrying about how the mentality of the modern player is. Ultimately, that was nothing about getting booted out, it was about him not playing well and if Garnacho was going to take his place."

Thoughts on the incident? Let us know in the comments.

data: {"title":"Mark Goldbridge reveals he reached out to one Man Utd player after issues turned toxic","description":"The incident happened in November last year.","url":"https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/man-utd-premier-league-mark-goldbridge-united-stand-370460-20241126","content":"Mark Goldbridge reveals he reached out to one Man Utd player after issues turned toxic - Man Utd - SPORTbible
===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**Mark Goldbridge reached out to Marcus Rashford and his agent after the Manchester United forward asked YouTube channel The United Stand to "stop spreading malicious rumours" on social media.**

Back in November last year, [**The United Stand**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rgJbBjOetmc&ab_channel=TheUnitedStand) – a channel founded by Goldbridge – made a video with the title: 'Rashford Future In Doubt?'

"Given Rashford's injury against Fulham and his recent subpar performances, the question arises: should he still be a regular starter for [Manchester United](https://www.sportbible.com/man-utd)?" the video description read. "Furthermore, with [Amad](https://www.sportbible.com/amad-diallo) returning, will he be given playing time?"

Advert

The United Stand posted a link to the YouTube video on [**X**](https://x.com/UnitedStandMUFC/status/1721467212756558266), formerly Twitter, at 9:59am and around an hour later, [Rashford](https://www.sportbible.com/marcus-rashford) responded by saying: "Please STOP spreading malicious rumours."

Just over a year later and United fan [Goldbridge](https://www.sportbible.com/mark-goldbridge) was asked about Rashford's response during a guest appearance on YouTube channel [**Webby & O'Neill**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NWnvDVIe3Og&ab_channel=Webby%26O%27Neill).

Here's how the conversation played out between Tony O'Neill and Mark Goldbridge.

Advert

**O'Neill**: "I'm going to talk about a player here, it's very controversial, in many ways, with his form and off-field antics. But you caused a big stir, and he caused a bigger stir, when he reacted to your YouTube channel. And that's Marcus Rashford.

"He posted a comment on one of your tweets. He said: 'Please stop spreading malicious rumours.'

"Now for a player to come out, and accuse you of spreading lies... what was your reaction?"

![Image 1: Marcus Rashford left a comment on The United Stand's post. Image credit: YouTube/Webby & O'Neill](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blt4e6718bfa37fd358/6745bca564734a1633b20477/Screenshot_2024-11-26_at_12.14.47.png)

Marcus Rashford left a comment on The United Stand's post. Image credit: YouTube/Webby & O'Neill

Advert

**Goldbridge**: "It's disappointing. Ultimately, I would love to see Marcus Rashford play good football for Manchester United and score goals. That's all that matters. I don't really care what he's like as a person. That's the bottom line.

"But in relation to that situation, we tried to reach out to his agent but got nothing back, to sort of say, 'C'mon. This is a guy who is doing book deals and charity work, and you are replying to something that's out of context. Look at the s\*\*\*storm it has caused.

"I'd say 75 per cent of people are saying, 'Oh, go on Rashford, well done' but 25 per cent are going, 'What are you doing?'. I also said, we aren't The Sun or talkSPORT, have you looked at what they are saying today?

"All we said was, 'Is Rashford's future in doubt?' Is that malicious? He was playing awful at the time. Why go after The United Stand? Why not go after another YouTube channel or a website.

Advert

"Is was either really naive and silly, which is concerning, or calculated to cause us trouble. This is one of the biggest earners and reputation players at Manchester United and you're getting involved in a Twitter thing like that."

![Image 2: Image credit: Getty ](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blt2ca71775290a8a08/6745c79671787a0cd1c99186/GettyImages-1774345271.jpg)

Image credit: Getty

He added: "And if he is bothered, that's even more worrying about how the mentality of the modern player is. Ultimately, that was nothing about getting booted out, it was about him not playing well and if Garnacho was going to take his place."

Thoughts on the incident? Let us know in the comments.

===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**Liverpool defender Andrew Robertson has broken Liverpool's silence after star player Mohamed Salah made a shock confession about his contract negotiations with the club.**

After their side came back back to [secure a hard-fought win over Southampton at St Mary's Stadium](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/liverpool/liverpool-southampton-arne-slot-336586-20241124), [Liverpool](https://www.sportbible.com/liverpool) fans were shocked as [Salah](https://www.sportbible.com/mohamed-salah) aimed a dig at the club over his current contract extension negotiations.

The Egyptian, who netted a brace in the match, revealed that [he is yet to receive an offer from to extend his stay at the club](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/liverpool/mo-salah-contract-negotiations-207279-20241125) ahead of his current deal expiring in the summer.

Advert

And now, teammate [Robertson](https://www.sportbible.com/andy-robertson) has become the first player at the club to adresss the comments, and he has made his stance on the situation clear.

Speaking ahead of Liverpool's [Champions League](https://www.sportbible.com/champions-league) clash with [Real Madrid](https://www.sportbible.com/real-madrid), Robertson said: "For us as players it's nothing we can get involved in.

"All I can say is: look at Mo today, yesterday, he's the ultimate professional. It goes for all three of them, Virgil and Trent too, they are so focused on the next game and being leaders."

Advert

Liverpool manager [Arne Slot](https://www.sportbible.com/arne-slot) also spoke out about the incident, assuring fans that nobody at the club is concerned or distracted by it, certainly not Salah himself.

He said: "I don't think Mo is distracted at all. He just keeps on scoring. He is fully focused. The media and fans talk about it but at the AXA I didn't see anyone talking about it."

The Scotsman is the first current Liverpool player to speak about Salah's comments, after former player [Jamie Carragher spoke out against the winger on Monday.](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/champions-league/liverpool-mo-salah-contract-jamie-carragher-475131-20241125)

![Image 1: Mohamed Salah scored a late penalty to seal a win for Liverpool over Southampton on Sunday. (Image: Getty)](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blta9921cd0d209cc89/6744459975374d0e1280dda8/GettyImages-2185782383.jpg)

Mohamed Salah scored a late penalty to seal a win for Liverpool over Southampton on Sunday. (Image: Getty)

Advert

“I must say, I am very disappointed with Mo Salah,” Carragher said on [Sky Sports’ MNF.](https://x.com/SkySportsPL/status/1861122528883691772)

“\[With\] that interview yesterday…Liverpool have got Real Madrid midweek and Manchester City at the weekend – that’s the story for Liverpool right now.

“And Mo Salah, we’re all quite aware…that in the seven years he has been at the football club, he’s stopped in the mixed zone twice, which is his right, which is absolutely fine.

“But he decided to stop for the third time away at Southampton on the back of winning Liverpool the game.”

![Image 2: comment bubble](https://www.sportbible.com/_next/static/media/comment-bubble.c94d2633.svg)0 comments

![Image 3: Ben McCrum](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=96&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/bltc37b34669c5d0287/66607f203899835a0b85d5f2/Ben_McCrum.jpg)

===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Not nowOK

**Liverpool superstar Mohamed Salah has spoken out about his current contract negotiations with the club, and fans are shocked.**

On Sunday, [Liverpool](https://www.sportbible.com/liverpool) continued their impressive form in the [Premier League](https://www.sportbible.com/premier-league) this season [as they came back to beat Southampton 3-2 at St Mary's Stadium.](https://www..com/football/football-news/liverpool/liverpool-southampton-arne-slot-336586-20241124)

As he has been on several occasions this season, [Salah](https://www.sportbible.com/mohamed-salah) was central to Liverpool's success in the match, scoring a brace to equalise and later win the hard-fought match.

Advert

However, after the match Salah made a huge revelation about his contract negotiations with Liverpool, [ahead of his current deal expiring in the summer.](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/liverpool/liverpool-alexanderarnold-van-dijk-salah-contracts-221169-20241122)

Speaking after Sunday's win against Southampton, Salah said: "We are almost in December and I haven't received any offers yet to stay in the club. I'm probably more out than in.

"You know I have been in the club for many years. There is no club like this. But in the end it is not in my hands. As I said, it is December and I haven't received anything yet about my future.

Advert

"I love the fans. The fans love me. In the end it is not in my hands or the fans' hands."

The Egyptian winger was then asked by reporters if he was disappointed about the current situation, he confessed: "Of course, yeah. I'm not going to retire soon so I'm just playing, focusing on the season and I'm trying to win the Premier League and hopefully the Champions League as well.

"I'm disappointed but we will see.

"I am very professional. Everybody can see my work ethic. I'm just trying to enjoy my football and I will play at the top level as long as possible."

Advert

![Image 1: Mohamed Salah scored a late penalty to seal a win for Liverpool over Southampton on Sunday. (Image: Getty)](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blta9921cd0d209cc89/6744459975374d0e1280dda8/GettyImages-2185782383.jpg)

Mohamed Salah scored a late penalty to seal a win for Liverpool over Southampton on Sunday. (Image: Getty)

Having played such a pivotal role in Liverpool's success in recent years, many fans believe Salah has earned the right to extend his stay with the club, extending his current deal which sees him earn £350,000 per week.

Reacting to the 32-year-old's shocking revelation on social media, one fan wrote: "Is this club actually serious?? Practically December and not an offer to our best player. Sort it out."

While one suggested: "Start protesting lads. Get the banners out this is an absolute disgrace."

Advert

And one noted: "This is insane. Mo Salah’s worth to Liverpool — on and off the pitch — can’t be underestimated.

"As well as being the best player in the Premier League he’s a cultural icon across the Arab world and beyond."

data: {"title":"Jamie Carragher expertly breaks down what Ruben Amorim wants from his Man Utd players and it's must-watch","description":"He has delivered a brilliant segment on United's tactics against Ipswich Town.","url":"https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/man-utd-ruben-amorim-jamie-carragher-ipswich-town-302730-20241126","content":"Jamie Carragher expertly breaks down what Ruben Amorim wants from his Man Utd players and it's must-watch - Man Utd - SPORTbible
===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**Jamie Carragher has delivered a must-watch segment on Manchester United's new 3-4-3 formation under Ruben Amorim as he analysed their 1-1 draw against Ipswich Town.**

Amorim's reign as United's head coach got off to the perfect start at Portman Road, when [Marcus Rashford](https://www.sportbible.com/marcus-rashford) opened the scoring after some superb wing-back play from [Amad Diallo](https://www.sportbible.com/amad-diallo).

Diallo, who has "improved so much defensively” in the past week, according to Amorim, picked up the ball in his own half before playing a one-two with Bruno Fernandes.

Advert

The Ivorian winger continued his run before delivering a perfectly-weighted ball to Rashford.

It was a piece of play that was analysed by Sky pundit [Jamie Carragher](https://www.sportbible.com/jamie-carragher) on the latest episode of [**Monday Night Football**](https://x.com/SkySportsPL/status/1861129055757607153) – and it really is a superb tactical breakdown of what Amorim wants from his players.

At times, Carragher was complementary towards the system as United switched to Amorim's favoured 3-4-3, but he did identify a weakness in the way they played against [Ipswich](https://www.sportbible.com/ipswich-town).

Advert

"I hear a lot of managers including [Ruben Amorim](https://www.sportbible.com/ruben-amorim) saying systems don't matter too much," Carragher began. "I believe that they do, no matter how many times managers tell me they don't because, well why do you play a different system?

"Different systems give you different things in different areas. For me, the weaknesses are in these spaces here, either side of the two central midfield players. The reason why is, when you play a conventional back four, your wide man can tuck in and help.

"But because you play a back three, when they get the ball they naturally go wider and wing backs go wider and higher. It means there's a lot more space around these two central midfield players, especially if the two attacking 10s don't drop back.

"There were the same issues on the Ipswich side as well. The big problem is - is it a midfielder who should drop in to fill that space or should a centre-back step in with someone?"

Advert

![Image 1: Image credit: Sky Sports/X](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blt0542222d6dee7723/67458635803d5c87b49cea3c/Screenshot_2024-11-26_at_08.11.18.png)

Image credit: Sky Sports/X

He added: "We listened to Ruben Amorim after the game and he spoke a lot about Jonny Evans not making that jump into the space to pick up a man. Because they played the same system, it almost became a man-to-man game. Football has become that."

Speaking after the game against Ipswich, Amorim admitted that his team struggled to properly adapt to his new formation, although he singled out one of his defenders for praise.

"It was really hard for them, they were thinking what to do, it was not fluid which is normal after just two training sessions but they tried hard," he said.

Advert

"They have so much space to improve. But after a draw you never feel the good things. So I am really happy because they tried but they can do so much better. We don't have too many centre-backs so we have to adapt some players."

Amorim added: "I thought Noussair Mazraoui did very well. He is so smart and is so important for us. He can play anywhere and that kind of player is crucial for our future."

Thoughts on Amorim's first game in charge as United manager? Let us know in the comments.

Speaking after the game against Ipswich, Amorim admitted that his team struggled to properly adapt to his new formation, although he singled out one of his defenders for praise.

"It was really hard for them, they were thinking what to do, it was not fluid which is normal after just two training sessions but they tried hard," he said.

Advert

"They have so much space to improve. But after a draw you never feel the good things. So I am really happy because they tried but they can do so much better. We don't have too many centre-backs so we have to adapt some players."

Amorim added: "I thought Noussair Mazraoui did very well. He is so smart and is so important for us. He can play anywhere and that kind of player is crucial for our future."

Thoughts on Amorim's first game in charge as United manager? Let us know in the comments.

===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**An Ipswich Town fan who was stood next to Roy Keane as he clashed with another supporter has opened up on what happened during the heated incident at Portman Road.**

In the aftermath of Sunday's Premier League clash between [Manchester United](https://www.sportbible.com/man-utd) and Ipswich, a furious Keane [was spotted confronting a supporter](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/roy-keane-man-utd-ipswich-fan-incident-887466-20241125) during an ad break.

Footage soon emerged of the heated incident, where Keane can be heard telling the supporter: "I’ll wait for you in the car park and we can discuss it."

Advert

Keane, who was punditry duty for Sky Sports, calmly headed back to the pitch after security and stewards diffused the situation. [Jamie Redknapp](https://www.sportbible.com/jamie-redknapp), meanwhile, was heard telling the group to "just leave it".

Now, season ticket holder Neil Finbow, 55, has given a further insight into the row after standing right next to the former Manchester United captain as the incident played out.

"It was the guy in the middle's comments that got him, I think," Finbow told [**The Mirror**](https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/ipswich-fan-roy-keane-manutd-34181330). "He was going on about his time when he was manager, how he treated his kids."

Finbow continued: "I will sort of defend [Roy Keane](https://www.sportbible.com/roy-keane) here as well, because it may be that the comment 'I'll see you in the car park' is to talk to the guy rather than take him out, so it can be misconstrued. I thought he was being quite aggressive, in hindsight.

Advert

"The guy had an issue, when \[Keane\] was at the club, when you see him point he was pointing to 'when you were here in the car park, you ignored my kids and swore at them', and he had an issue with that. So obviously that's been pent-up."

He added: "I don't have any regrets \[about going down the front\]. It's pent-up anger. No swear words came out of my mouth, I just said 'you're a better pundit than you are a manager'."

Sky Sports will reportedly investigate the incident to see if any action is needed, while Finbow admits he is concerned about the future of his season ticket.

"Everyone I sit with knows what I'm like," he said. "I'm in the family bit there, I've been there for years. I do worry about my season ticket, someone has put on there that it could affect it, but I don't think I've been abusive or anything. If people class that as abuse then it's just gone mad."

Advert

![Image 1: Roy Keane clashed with an Ipswich supporter. Image credit: @adenLFC4life](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blt2fa836e8eed479ad/6745a219f1b176ed29082380/Screenshot_2024-11-26_at_10.24.45.png)

Roy Keane clashed with an Ipswich supporter. Image credit: @adenLFC4life

Finbow added: "I want my side to be heard, that it was more sarcasm than anything. To be fair, he's provoked it by coming over, hasn't he? I was actually saying 'calm down, Roy', funnily enough, which I've been telling a lot of my friends to do this morning."

_SPORTbible have reached out to Sky Sports for comment._

data: {"title":""He was.." - Ipswich fan who was next to Roy Keane during furious incident reveals what sparked 'car park' row","description":"Neil Finbow, a season ticket holder at Ipswich Town, has given his take on the incident.","url":"https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/roy-keane-ipswich-town-man-utd-premier-league-674563-20241126","content":""He was.." - Ipswich fan who was next to Roy Keane during furious incident reveals what sparked 'car park' row - Man Utd - SPORTbible
===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**An Ipswich Town fan who was stood next to Roy Keane as he clashed with another supporter has opened up on what happened during the heated incident at Portman Road.**

In the aftermath of Sunday's Premier League clash between [Manchester United](https://www.sportbible.com/man-utd) and Ipswich, a furious Keane [was spotted confronting a supporter](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/roy-keane-man-utd-ipswich-fan-incident-887466-20241125) during an ad break.

Footage soon emerged of the heated incident, where Keane can be heard telling the supporter: "I’ll wait for you in the car park and we can discuss it."

Advert

Keane, who was punditry duty for Sky Sports, calmly headed back to the pitch after security and stewards diffused the situation. [Jamie Redknapp](https://www.sportbible.com/jamie-redknapp), meanwhile, was heard telling the group to "just leave it".

Now, season ticket holder Neil Finbow, 55, has given a further insight into the row after standing right next to the former Manchester United captain as the incident played out.

"It was the guy in the middle's comments that got him, I think," Finbow told [**The Mirror**](https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/ipswich-fan-roy-keane-manutd-34181330). "He was going on about his time when he was manager, how he treated his kids."

Finbow continued: "I will sort of defend [Roy Keane](https://www.sportbible.com/roy-keane) here as well, because it may be that the comment 'I'll see you in the car park' is to talk to the guy rather than take him out, so it can be misconstrued. I thought he was being quite aggressive, in hindsight.

Advert

"The guy had an issue, when \[Keane\] was at the club, when you see him point he was pointing to 'when you were here in the car park, you ignored my kids and swore at them', and he had an issue with that. So obviously that's been pent-up."

He added: "I don't have any regrets \[about going down the front\]. It's pent-up anger. No swear words came out of my mouth, I just said 'you're a better pundit than you are a manager'."

Sky Sports will reportedly investigate the incident to see if any action is needed, while Finbow admits he is concerned about the future of his season ticket.

"Everyone I sit with knows what I'm like," he said. "I'm in the family bit there, I've been there for years. I do worry about my season ticket, someone has put on there that it could affect it, but I don't think I've been abusive or anything. If people class that as abuse then it's just gone mad."

Advert
